QUOTE: True art is characterized by an irresistible urge in the creative artist.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.
AUTHOR: Vincent Van Gogh

QUOTE: The highest art is always the most religious, and the greatest artist is always a devout person.
AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln

QUOTE: The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.
AUTHOR: Pablo Picasso

QUOTE: A work of art is the unique result of a unique temperament.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: No great artist ever sees things as they really are. If he did, he would cease to be an artist.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: Without tradition, art is a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Without innovation, it is a corpse.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: Art is the most intense mode of individualism that the world has known.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: The essence of all beautiful art, all great art, is gratitude.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: Life imitates art far more than art imitates Life.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: Every artist was first an amateur.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
AUTHOR: Thomas Merton

QUOTE: Art is a step from what is obvious and well-known toward what is arcane and concealed.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: In art, the hand can never execute anything higher than the heart can imagine.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: A guilty conscience needs to confess. A work of art is a confession.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: This world is but a canvas to our imagination.
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: An artist is not paid for his labor but for his vision.
AUTHOR: James Whistler

QUOTE: We have art in order not to die of the truth.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: A picture is worth a thousand words.
AUTHOR: Napoleon Bonaparte

QUOTE: Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep.
AUTHOR: Scott Adams

QUOTE: Pictures must not be too picturesque.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: Art is the proper task of life.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: If you do not breathe through writing, if you do not cry out in writing, or sing in writing, then don't write, because our culture has no use for it.
AUTHOR: Anais Nin

QUOTE: Art is the only way to run away without leaving home.
AUTHOR: Twyla Tharp

QUOTE: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
AUTHOR: Confucius

QUOTE: To love beauty is to see light.
AUTHOR: Victor Hugo

QUOTE: The pursuit of truth and beauty is a sphere of activity in which we are permitted to remain children all our lives.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: A woman whose smile is open and whose expression is glad has a kind of beauty no matter what she wears.
AUTHOR: Anne Roiphe

QUOTE: Of life's two chief prizes, beauty and truth, I found the first in a loving heart and the second in a laborer's hand.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: Beauty is only skin deep. If you go after someone just because she's beautiful but don't have anything to talk about, it's going to get boring fast. You want to look beyond the surface and see if you can have fun or if you have anything in common with this person.
AUTHOR: Amanda Peet

QUOTE: People are like stained - glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in, their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within.
AUTHOR: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

QUOTE: Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.
AUTHOR: Ashley Smith

QUOTE: Beauty awakens the soul to act.
AUTHOR: Dante Alighieri

QUOTE: A thing of beauty is a joy forever: its loveliness increases; it will never pass into nothingness.
AUTHOR: John Keats

QUOTE: Beauty of whatever kind, in its supreme development, invariably excites the sensitive soul to tears.
AUTHOR: Edgar Allan Poe

QUOTE: The soul that sees beauty may sometimes walk alone.
AUTHOR: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

QUOTE: Flowers... are a proud assertion that a ray of beauty outvalues all the utilities of the world.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: Personal beauty is a greater recommendation than any letter of reference.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: The world's biggest power is the youth and beauty of a woman.
AUTHOR: Chanakya

QUOTE: She got her looks from her father. He's a plastic surgeon.
AUTHOR: Groucho Marx

QUOTE: A beauty is a woman you notice; a charmer is one who notices you.
AUTHOR: Adlai E. Stevenson

QUOTE: Beauty and folly are old companions.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

QUOTE: Rare is the union of beauty and purity.
AUTHOR: Juvenal

QUOTE: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.
AUTHOR: Anne Frank

QUOTE: Beauty is all very well at first sight; but who ever looks at it when it has been in the house three days?
AUTHOR: George Bernard Shaw

QUOTE: Beauty is unbearable, drives us to despair, offering us for a minute the glimpse of an eternity that we should like to stretch out over the whole of time.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: Beauty is a manifestation of secret natural laws, which otherwise would have been hidden from us forever.
AUTHOR: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

QUOTE: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
AUTHOR: Lao Tzu

QUOTE: Sometimes the heart sees what is invisible to the eye.
AUTHOR: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

QUOTE: Friends can help each other. A true friend is someone who lets you have total freedom to be yourself - and especially to feel. Or, not feel. Whatever you happen to be feeling at the moment is fine with them. That's what real love amounts to - letting a person be what he really is.
AUTHOR: Jim Morrison

QUOTE: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: I have decided to stick with love. Hate is too great a burden to bear.
AUTHOR: Martin Luther King, Jr.

QUOTE: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.
AUTHOR: Bruce Lee

QUOTE: Immature love says: 'I love you because I need you.' Mature love says 'I need you because I love you.'
AUTHOR: Erich Fromm

QUOTE: Affection is responsible for nine-tenths of whatever solid and durable happiness there is in our lives.
AUTHOR: C. S. Lewis

QUOTE: Where there is love there is life.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
AUTHOR: Orson Welles

QUOTE: A loving heart is the beginning of all knowledge.
AUTHOR: Thomas Carlyle

QUOTE: I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love.
AUTHOR: Mother Teresa

QUOTE: For it was not into my ear you whispered, but into my heart. It was not my lips you kissed, but my soul.
AUTHOR: Judy Garland

QUOTE: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
AUTHOR: Mother Teresa

QUOTE: A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous.
AUTHOR: Ingrid Bergman

QUOTE: A man reserves his true and deepest love not for the species of woman in whose company he finds himself electrified and enkindled, but for that one in whose company he may feel tenderly drowsy.
AUTHOR: George Jean Nathan

QUOTE: If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you.
AUTHOR: A. A. Milne

QUOTE: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: A flower cannot blossom without sunshine, and man cannot live without love.
AUTHOR: Max Muller

QUOTE: Love begins at home, and it is not how much we do... but how much love we put in that action.
AUTHOR: Mother Teresa

QUOTE: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
AUTHOR: James A. Baldwin

QUOTE: Can miles truly separate you from friends... If you want to be with someone you love, aren't you already there?
AUTHOR: Richard Bach

QUOTE: A woman knows the face of the man she loves as a sailor knows the open sea.
AUTHOR: Honore de Balzac

QUOTE: A man is already halfway in love with any woman who listens to him.
AUTHOR: Brendan Francis

QUOTE: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
AUTHOR: Robert Frost

QUOTE: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
AUTHOR: Buddha

QUOTE: Throughout life people will make you mad, disrespect you and treat you bad. Let God deal with the things they do, cause hate in your heart will consume you too.
AUTHOR: Will Smith

QUOTE: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
AUTHOR: George Bernard Shaw

QUOTE: Life is a song - sing it. Life is a game - play it. Life is a challenge - meet it. Life is a dream - realize it. Life is a sacrifice - offer it. Life is love - enjoy it.
AUTHOR: Sai Baba

QUOTE: Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life; define yourself.
AUTHOR: Harvey Fierstein

QUOTE: When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me'.
AUTHOR: Erma Bombeck

QUOTE: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
AUTHOR: William James

QUOTE: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
AUTHOR: Sholom Aleichem

QUOTE: The truth is you don't know what is going to happen tomorrow. Life is a crazy ride, and nothing is guaranteed.
AUTHOR: Eminem

QUOTE: Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.
AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy

QUOTE: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
AUTHOR: Confucius

QUOTE: Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living?
AUTHOR: Bob Marley

QUOTE: I still find each day too short for all the thoughts I want to think, all the walks I want to take, all the books I want to read, and all the friends I want to see.
AUTHOR: John Burroughs

QUOTE: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: How far you go in life depends on your being tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving and tolerant of the weak and strong. Because someday in your life you will have been all of these.
AUTHOR: George Washington Carver

QUOTE: Life is what happens while you are busy making other plans.
AUTHOR: John Lennon

QUOTE: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
AUTHOR: Charles Darwin

QUOTE: Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them - that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
AUTHOR: Lao Tzu

QUOTE: My formula for living is quite simple. I get up in the morning and I go to bed at night. In between, I occupy myself as best I can.
AUTHOR: Cary Grant

QUOTE: I have a simple philosophy: Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. Scratch where it itches.
AUTHOR: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

QUOTE: The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Information is not knowledge.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Knowledge of what is does not open the door directly to what should be.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
AUTHOR: Confucius

QUOTE: Ignorance is the curse of God; knowledge is the wing wherewith we fly to heaven.
AUTHOR: William Shakespeare

QUOTE: A people without the knowledge of their past history, origin and culture is like a tree without roots.
AUTHOR: Marcus Garvey

QUOTE: He who knows nothing is closer to the truth than he whose mind is filled with falsehoods and errors.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: Knowledge is love and light and vision.
AUTHOR: Helen Keller

QUOTE: I was bold in the pursuit of knowledge, never fearing to follow truth and reason to whatever results they led, and bearding every authority which stood in their way.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: Pain and foolishness lead to great bliss and complete knowledge, for Eternal Wisdom created nothing under the sun in vain.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: No man can reveal to you nothing but that which already lies half-asleep in the dawning of your knowledge.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: Perplexity is the beginning of knowledge.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: If money is your hope for independence you will never have it. The only real security that a man will have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience, and ability.
AUTHOR: Henry Ford

QUOTE: To know, is to know that you know nothing. That is the meaning of true knowledge.
AUTHOR: Socrates

QUOTE: When you know a thing, to hold that you know it, and when you do not know a thing, to allow that you do not know it - this is knowledge.
AUTHOR: Confucius

QUOTE: Knowledge is knowing that we cannot know.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: It is not when truth is dirty, but when it is shallow, that the lover of knowledge is reluctant to step into its waters.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: And what, Socrates, is the food of the soul? Surely, I said, knowledge is the food of the soul.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: Opinion is the medium between knowledge and ignorance.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: To know that we know what we know, and to know that we do not know what we do not know, that is true knowledge.
AUTHOR: Nicolaus Copernicus

QUOTE: The learning and knowledge that we have, is, at the most, but little compared with that of which we are ignorant.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: Entire ignorance is not so terrible or extreme an evil, and is far from being the greatest of all; too much cleverness and too much learning, accompanied with ill bringing-up, are far more fatal.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: All the knowledge I possess everyone else can acquire, but my heart is all my own.
AUTHOR: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

QUOTE: We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty, charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures that we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.
AUTHOR: Jawaharlal Nehru

QUOTE: Beauty is ever to the lonely mind a shadow fleeting; she is never plain. She is a visitor who leaves behind the gift of grief, the souvenir of pain.
AUTHOR: Christopher Morley

QUOTE: Every year of my life I grow more convinced that it is wisest and best to fix our attention on the beautiful and the good, and dwell as little as possible on the evil and the false.
AUTHOR: Richard Cecil

QUOTE: A women's greatest asset is her beauty.
AUTHOR: Alex Comfort

QUOTE: The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express.
AUTHOR: Francis Bacon

QUOTE: In every man's heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibrations of beauty.
AUTHOR: Christopher Morley

QUOTE: Beauty is only temporary, but your mind lasts you a lifetime.
AUTHOR: Alicia Machado

QUOTE: If you look closely at a tree you'll notice it's knots and dead branches, just like our bodies. What we learn is that beauty and imperfection go together wonderfully.
AUTHOR: Matthew Fox

QUOTE: Beauty is a fragile gift.
AUTHOR: Ovid

QUOTE: In youth and beauty, wisdom is but rare!
AUTHOR: Homer

QUOTE: I don't need plastic in my body to validate me as a woman.
AUTHOR: Courtney Love

QUOTE: Love built on beauty, soon as beauty, dies.
AUTHOR: John Donne

QUOTE: When virtue and modesty enlighten her charms, the lustre of a beautiful woman is brighter than the stars of heaven, and the influence of her power it is in vain to resist.
AUTHOR: Akhenaton

QUOTE: I gave my beauty and my youth to men. I am going to give my wisdom and experience to animals.
AUTHOR: Brigitte Bardot

QUOTE: Heat cannot be separated from fire, or beauty from The Eternal.
AUTHOR: Dante Alighieri

QUOTE: There is a kind of beauty in imperfection.
AUTHOR: Conrad Hall

QUOTE: Beauty saves. Beauty heals. Beauty motivates. Beauty unites. Beauty returns us to our origins, and here lies the ultimate act of saving, of healing, of overcoming dualism.
AUTHOR: Matthew Fox

QUOTE: The problem with beauty is that it's like being born rich and getting poorer.
AUTHOR: Joan Collins

QUOTE: Beauty is less important than quality.
AUTHOR: Eugene Ormandy

QUOTE: Gorgeous hair is the best revenge.
AUTHOR: Ivana Trump

QUOTE: Beauty is whatever gives joy.
AUTHOR: Edna St. Vincent Millay

QUOTE: Having inner beauty is something you develop on your own, and I like to think I have that.
AUTHOR: Cindy Margolis

QUOTE: Beauty is variable, ugliness is constant.
AUTHOR: Douglas Horton

QUOTE: If you get simple beauty and naught else, you get about the best thing God invents.
AUTHOR: Robert Browning

QUOTE: Zest is the secret of all beauty. There is no beauty that is attractive without zest.
AUTHOR: Christian Dior

QUOTE: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
AUTHOR: Marcus Aurelius

QUOTE: Anyone who doesn't take truth seriously in small matters cannot be trusted in large ones either.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
AUTHOR: Buddha

QUOTE: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.
AUTHOR: Buddha

QUOTE: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word in reality. This is why right, temporarily defeated, is stronger than evil triumphant.
AUTHOR: Martin Luther King, Jr.

QUOTE: I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts.
AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln

QUOTE: The truth is incontrovertible. Malice may attack it, ignorance may deride it, but in the end, there it is.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: If you are out to describe the truth, leave elegance to the tailor.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: In matters of truth and justice, there is no difference between large and small problems, for issues concerning the treatment of people are all the same.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Even if you are a minority of one, the truth is the truth.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: In a time of universal deceit - telling the truth is a revolutionary act.
AUTHOR: George Orwell

QUOTE: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: An error does not become truth by reason of multiplied propagation, nor does truth become error because nobody sees it.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: If you look for truth, you may find comfort in the end; if you look for comfort you will not get either comfort or truth only soft soap and wishful thinking to begin, and in the end, despair.
AUTHOR: C. S. Lewis

QUOTE: It's no wonder that truth is stranger than fiction. Fiction has to make sense.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Truth is by nature self-evident. As soon as you remove the cobwebs of ignorance that surround it, it shines clear.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure the truth.
AUTHOR: Maya Angelou

QUOTE: Truth is the most valuable thing we have. Let us economize it.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.
AUTHOR: Arthur Schopenhauer

QUOTE: Reason is the natural order of truth; but imagination is the organ of meaning.
AUTHOR: C. S. Lewis

QUOTE: Truth is a deep kindness that teaches us to be content in our everyday life and share with the people the same happiness.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: The great enemy of the truth is very often not the lie, deliberate, contrived and dishonest, but the myth, persistent, persuasive and unrealistic.
AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy

QUOTE: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.
AUTHOR: John Wooden

QUOTE: I believe that a simple and unassuming manner of life is best for everyone, best both for the body and the mind.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: In the practice of tolerance, one's enemy is the best teacher.
AUTHOR: Dalai Lama

QUOTE: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
AUTHOR: Buddha

QUOTE: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing, the next best thing is the wrong thing, and the worst thing you can do is nothing.
AUTHOR: Theodore Roosevelt

QUOTE: You have to accept whatever comes and the only important thing is that you meet it with courage and with the best that you have to give.
AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt

QUOTE: I do the very best I know how - the very best I can; and I mean to keep on doing so until the end.
AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln

QUOTE: The best road to progress is freedom's road.
AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy

QUOTE: To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best, night and day, to make you everybody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight; and never stop fighting.
AUTHOR: e. e. cummings

QUOTE: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
AUTHOR: Ernest Hemingway

QUOTE: I never had a policy; I have just tried to do my very best each and every day.
AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln

QUOTE: The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: I am easily satisfied with the very best.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: Learn to say 'no' to the good so you can say 'yes' to the best.
AUTHOR: John C. Maxwell

QUOTE: He who knows best knows how little he knows.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: But men are men; the best sometimes forget.
AUTHOR: William Shakespeare

QUOTE: When we do the best that we can, we never know what miracle is wrought in our life, or in the life of another.
AUTHOR: Helen Keller

QUOTE: At his best, man is the noblest of all animals; separated from law and justice he is the worst.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
AUTHOR: Marcus Aurelius

QUOTE: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
AUTHOR: Carl Jung

QUOTE: A woman knows by intuition, or instinct, what is best for herself.
AUTHOR: Marilyn Monroe

QUOTE: Why don't you start believing that no matter what you have or haven't done, that your best days are still out in front of you.
AUTHOR: Joel Osteen

QUOTE: Expect the best. Prepare for the worst. Capitalize on what comes.
AUTHOR: Zig Ziglar

QUOTE: We gain strength, and courage, and confidence by each experience in which we really stop to look fear in the face... we must do that which we think we cannot.
AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt

QUOTE: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
AUTHOR: Helen Keller

QUOTE: Only one who devotes himself to a cause with his whole strength and soul can be a true master. For this reason mastery demands all of a person.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men.
AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy

QUOTE: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
AUTHOR: Ernest Hemingway

QUOTE: I love those who can smile in trouble, who can gather strength from distress, and grow brave by reflection. 'Tis the business of little minds to shrink, but they whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves their conduct, will pursue their principles unto death.
AUTHOR: Leonardo da Vinci

QUOTE: Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. When you go through hardships and decide not to surrender, that is strength.
AUTHOR: Arnold Schwarzenegger

QUOTE: Only the weak are cruel. Gentleness can only be expected from the strong.
AUTHOR: Leo Buscaglia

QUOTE: Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself is true power.
AUTHOR: Lao Tzu

QUOTE: A mind at peace, a mind centered and not focused on harming others, is stronger than any physical force in the universe.
AUTHOR: Wayne Dyer

QUOTE: We can be tired, weary and emotionally distraught, but after spending time alone with God, we find that He injects into our bodies energy, power and strength.
AUTHOR: Charles Stanley

QUOTE: Strength of character means the ability to overcome resentment against others, to hide hurt feelings, and to forgive quickly.
AUTHOR: Lawrence G. Lovasik

QUOTE: Some of us think holding on makes us strong; but sometimes it is letting go.
AUTHOR: Hermann Hesse

QUOTE: Shallow men believe in luck. Strong men believe in cause and effect.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
AUTHOR: Marcus Aurelius

QUOTE: The world is the great gymnasium where we come to make ourselves strong.
AUTHOR: Swami Vivekananda

QUOTE: Perhaps I am stronger than I think.
AUTHOR: Thomas Merton

QUOTE: Where there is no struggle, there is no strength.
AUTHOR: Oprah Winfrey

QUOTE: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
AUTHOR: Og Mandino

QUOTE: Does anybody really think that they didn't get what they had because they didn't have the talent or the strength or the endurance or the commitment?
AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela

QUOTE: Strength and growth come only through continuous effort and struggle.
AUTHOR: Napoleon Hill

QUOTE: Good actions give strength to ourselves and inspire good actions in others.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt

QUOTE: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.
AUTHOR: William Shakespeare

QUOTE: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: One sees great things from the valley; only small things from the peak.
AUTHOR: Gilbert K. Chesterton

QUOTE: I am the greatest, I said that even before I knew I was.
AUTHOR: Muhammad Ali

QUOTE: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
AUTHOR: Maya Angelou

QUOTE: I firmly believe that any man's finest hour, the greatest fulfillment of all that he holds dear, is that moment when he has worked his heart out in a good cause and lies exhausted on the field of battle - victorious.
AUTHOR: Vince Lombardi

QUOTE: One of the greatest diseases is to be nobody to anybody.
AUTHOR: Mother Teresa

QUOTE: The great question that has never been answered, and which I have not yet been able to answer, despite my thirty years of research into the feminine soul, is 'What does a woman want?'
AUTHOR: Sigmund Freud

QUOTE: Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: I may climb perhaps to no great heights, but I will climb alone.
AUTHOR: Cyrano de Bergerac

QUOTE: I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
AUTHOR: Helen Keller

QUOTE: Laws control the lesser man... Right conduct controls the greater one.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.
AUTHOR: Chanakya

QUOTE: After climbing a great hill, one only finds that there are many more hills to climb.
AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela

QUOTE: All truly great thoughts are conceived by walking.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
AUTHOR: Robert Kennedy

QUOTE: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy

QUOTE: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
AUTHOR: Socrates

QUOTE: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.
AUTHOR: Oprah Winfrey

QUOTE: The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires.
AUTHOR: William Arthur Ward

QUOTE: Could a greater miracle take place than for us to look through each other's eyes for an instant?
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: Because of a great love, one is courageous.
AUTHOR: Lao Tzu

QUOTE: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Disraeli

QUOTE: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
AUTHOR: Elbert Hubbard

QUOTE: Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.
AUTHOR: Buddha

QUOTE: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
AUTHOR: Muhammad Ali

QUOTE: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
AUTHOR: Oprah Winfrey

QUOTE: When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand.
AUTHOR: Henri Nouwen

QUOTE: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
AUTHOR: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

QUOTE: In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
AUTHOR: Albert Schweitzer

QUOTE: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down.
AUTHOR: Arnold H. Glasow

QUOTE: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
AUTHOR: Leo Buscaglia

QUOTE: I value the friend who for me finds time on his calendar, but I cherish the friend who for me does not consult his calendar.
AUTHOR: Robert Brault

QUOTE: True friends stab you in the front.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: Think where man's glory most begins and ends, and say my glory was I had such friends.
AUTHOR: William Butler Yeats

QUOTE: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
AUTHOR: Marcel Proust

QUOTE: A friend should be one in whose understanding and virtue we can equally confide, and whose opinion we can value at once for its justness and its sincerity.
AUTHOR: Robert Hall

QUOTE: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.
AUTHOR: C. S. Lewis

QUOTE: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
AUTHOR: George Washington

QUOTE: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
AUTHOR: Jim Morrison

QUOTE: A friendship can weather most things and thrive in thin soil; but it needs a little mulch of letters and phone calls and small, silly presents every so often - just to save it from drying out completely.
AUTHOR: Pam Brown

QUOTE: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
AUTHOR: Henri Nouwen

QUOTE: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
AUTHOR: Helen Keller

QUOTE: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.
AUTHOR: William Penn

QUOTE: A friend to all is a friend to none.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: Friendship is a single soul dwelling in two bodies.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: Do all things with love.
AUTHOR: Og Mandino

QUOTE: Love is a force more formidable than any other. It is invisible - it cannot be seen or measured, yet it is powerful enough to transform you in a moment, and offer you more joy than any material possession could.
AUTHOR: Barbara de Angelis

QUOTE: Time is too slow for those who wait, too swift for those who fear, too long for those who grieve, too short for those who rejoice, but for those who love, time is eternity.
AUTHOR: Henry Van Dyke

QUOTE: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.
AUTHOR: Thomas Merton

QUOTE: I was born with an enormous need for affection, and a terrible need to give it.
AUTHOR: Audrey Hepburn

QUOTE: Love is a better teacher than duty.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: We love life, not because we are used to living but because we are used to loving.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
AUTHOR: Lucille Ball

QUOTE: At the touch of love everyone becomes a poet.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: Absence diminishes mediocre passions and increases great ones, as the wind extinguishes candles and fans fires.
AUTHOR: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

QUOTE: A kiss makes the heart young again and wipes out the years.
AUTHOR: Rupert Brooke

QUOTE: The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread.
AUTHOR: Mother Teresa

QUOTE: Love is always bestowed as a gift - freely, willingly and without expectation. We don't love to be loved; we love to love.

QUOTE: Love is like war: easy to begin but very hard to stop.
AUTHOR: H. L. Mencken

QUOTE: What we have once enjoyed we can never lose. All that we love deeply becomes a part of us.
AUTHOR: Helen Keller

QUOTE: Come live in my heart, and pay no rent.
AUTHOR: Samuel Lover

QUOTE: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
AUTHOR: Audrey Hepburn

QUOTE: If you press me to say why I loved him, I can say no more than because he was he, and I was I.

QUOTE: Love is life. And if you miss love, you miss life.
AUTHOR: Leo Buscaglia

QUOTE: As soon go kindle fire with snow, as seek to quench the fire of love with words.
AUTHOR: William Shakespeare

QUOTE: Faith makes all things possible... love makes all things easy.
AUTHOR: Dwight L. Moody

QUOTE: Friendship often ends in love; but love in friendship - never.
AUTHOR: Charles Caleb Colton

QUOTE: The best proof of love is trust.
AUTHOR: Joyce Brothers

QUOTE: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: Love isn't something you find. Love is something that finds you.
AUTHOR: Loretta Young

QUOTE: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
AUTHOR: Martin Luther King, Jr.

QUOTE: My great hope is to laugh as much as I cry; to get my work done and try to love somebody and have the courage to accept the love in return.

QUOTE: None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free.
AUTHOR: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

QUOTE: I find hope in the darkest of days, and focus in the brightest. I do not judge the universe.

QUOTE: I hope to stand firm enough to not go backward, and yet not go forward fast enough to wreck the country's cause.

QUOTE: Lord save us all from a hope tree that has lost the faculty of putting out blossoms.

QUOTE: Hope in reality is the worst of all evils because it prolongs the torments of man.

QUOTE: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.

QUOTE: Three grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.

QUOTE: This suspense is terrible. I hope it will last.

QUOTE: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul - and sings the tunes without the words - and never stops at all.

QUOTE: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.

QUOTE: He that lives upon hope will die fasting.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

QUOTE: Be careful to leave your sons well instructed rather than rich, for the hopes of the instructed are better than the wealth of the ignorant.
AUTHOR: Epictetus

QUOTE: Youth is easily deceived because it is quick to hope.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: Hope is the dream of a waking man.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: You may not always have a comfortable life and you will not always be able to solve all of the world's problems at once but don't ever underestimate the importance you can have because history has shown us that courage can be contagious and hope can take on a life of its own.
AUTHOR: Michelle Obama

QUOTE: We must free ourselves of the hope that the sea will ever rest. We must learn to sail in high winds.
AUTHOR: Aristotle Onassis

QUOTE: In the end, that's what this election is about. Do we participate in a politics of cynicism or a politics of hope?
AUTHOR: Barack Obama

QUOTE: Never deprive someone of hope; it might be all they have.
AUTHOR: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

QUOTE: Courage is like love; it must have hope for nourishment.

QUOTE: Everything that is done in the world is done by hope.

QUOTE: Hope is tomorrow's veneer over today's disappointment.
AUTHOR: Evan Esar

QUOTE: Tomorrow hopes we have learned something from yesterday.

QUOTE: True love doesn't come to you it has to be inside you.
AUTHOR: Julia Roberts

QUOTE: A woman has two smiles that an angel might envy, the smile that accepts a lover before words are uttered, and the smile that lights on the first born babe, and assures it of a mother's love.

QUOTE: That we must love one God only is a thing so evident that it does not require miracles to prove it.
AUTHOR: Blaise Pascal

QUOTE: I love my son and am proud of my son.

QUOTE: True humor springs not more from the head than from the heart. It is not contempt; its essence is love. It issues not in laughter, but in still smiles, which lie far deeper.

QUOTE: Man's love is of man's life a part; it is a woman's whole existence. In her first passion, a woman loves her lover, in all the others all she loves is love.

QUOTE: A religious man is a person who holds God and man in one thought at one time, at all times, who suffers harm done to others, whose greatest passion is compassion, whose greatest strength is love and defiance of despair.

QUOTE: If we judge love by most of its effects, it resembles rather hatred than affection.

QUOTE: Everybody's journey is individual. If you fall in love with a boy, you fall in love with a boy. The fact that many Americans consider it a disease says more about them than it does about homosexuality.

QUOTE: Do what you love; you'll be better at it. It sounds pretty simple, but you'd be surprised how many people don't get this one right away.

QUOTE: The best portion of a good man's life is his little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.

QUOTE: Love has its place, as does hate. Peace has its place, as does war. Mercy has its place, as do cruelty and revenge.

QUOTE: From your parents you learn love and laughter and how to put one foot before the other. But when books are opened you discover that you have wings.

QUOTE: I can't imagine anything more worthwhile than doing what I most love. And they pay me for it.

QUOTE: I love my family and I miss them very much but I'm a new person now. I know a lot of people will not agree with what I've done, but it was right for me.

QUOTE: A lot of women don't know how to love because there's deep reasons for them not knowing how to love. And what I mean by deep reasons is deep and dark reasons.

QUOTE: The first time you marry for love, the second for money, and the third for companionship.

QUOTE: The answer to all writing, to any career for that matter, is love.

QUOTE: If you love it enough, anything will talk with you.

QUOTE: I have felt cats rubbing their faces against mine and touching my cheek with claws carefully sheathed. These things, to me, are expressions of love.

QUOTE: When a man must force himself to be faithful in his love, this is hardly better than unfaithfulness.

QUOTE: The word love has by no means the same sense for both sexes, and this is one cause of the serious misunderstandings that divide them.

QUOTE: I love Wagner, but the music I prefer is that of a cat hung up by its tail outside a window and trying to stick to the panes of glass with its claws.

QUOTE: If love does not know how to give and take without restrictions, it is not love, but a transaction that never fails to lay stress on a plus and a minus.

QUOTE: It is not length of life, but depth of life.

QUOTE: Life is 10 percent what you make it, and 90 percent how you take it.

QUOTE: The true secret of happiness lies in taking a genuine interest in all the details of daily life.

QUOTE: Don't go through life, grow through life.

QUOTE: Here is the test to find whether your mission on Earth is finished: if you're alive, it isn't.

QUOTE: Once you say you're going to settle for second, that's what happens to you in life.

QUOTE: Don't let life discourage you; everyone who got where he is had to begin where he was.

QUOTE: There are three constants in life... change, choice and principles.

QUOTE: Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about.

QUOTE: Beware the barrenness of a busy life.

QUOTE: I love those who yearn for the impossible.

QUOTE: Every creature is better alive than dead, men and moose and pine trees, and he who understands it aright will rather preserve its life than destroy it.

QUOTE: Life consists not in holding good cards but in playing those you hold well.

QUOTE: Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say yes.

QUOTE: What it lies in our power to do, it lies in our power not to do.

QUOTE: All the forces in the world are not so powerful as an idea whose time has come.

QUOTE: Every man builds his world in his own image. He has the power to choose, but no power to escape the necessity of choice.

QUOTE: Knowledge is power.

QUOTE: To achieve, you need thought. You have to know what you are doing and that's real power.

QUOTE: I believe that if life gives you lemons, you should make lemonade... And try to find somebody whose life has given them vodka, and have a party.

QUOTE: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.

QUOTE: When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. That's relativity.

QUOTE: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
AUTHOR: Elbert Hubbard

QUOTE: I feel sorry for people who don't drink. When they wake up in the morning, that's as good as they're going to feel all day.

QUOTE: Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Wine is constant proof that God loves us and loves to see us happy.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

QUOTE: A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.

QUOTE: A government that robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul.

QUOTE: As a child my family's menu consisted of two choices: take it or leave it.

QUOTE: Get your facts first, then you can distort them as you please.

QUOTE: People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.

QUOTE: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the hell she is.

QUOTE: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.
AUTHOR: Mae West

QUOTE: My fake plants died because I did not pretend to water them.
AUTHOR: Mitch Hedberg

QUOTE: If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Housework can't kill you, but why take a chance?

QUOTE: A woman's mind is cleaner than a man's: She changes it more often.

QUOTE: Any girl can be glamorous. All you have to do is stand still and look stupid.

QUOTE: A lot of people are afraid of heights. Not me, I'm afraid of widths.

QUOTE: I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific.

QUOTE: I have six locks on my door all in a row. When I go out, I lock every other one. I figure no matter how long somebody stands there picking the locks, they are always locking three.

QUOTE: A two-year-old is kind of like having a blender, but you don't have a top for it.
AUTHOR: Jerry Seinfeld

QUOTE: The best thing about the future is that it comes one day at a time.
AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln

QUOTE: Let him who would enjoy a good future waste none of his present.
AUTHOR: Roger Babson

QUOTE: Lost time is never found again.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

QUOTE: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of 60 minutes an hour, whatever he does, whoever he is.
AUTHOR: C. S. Lewis

QUOTE: Patience and time do more than strength or passion.

QUOTE: We are time's subjects, and time bids be gone.
AUTHOR: William Shakespeare

QUOTE: If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have time to do it over?
AUTHOR: John Wooden

QUOTE: You may delay, but time will not.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

QUOTE: Time is money.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

QUOTE: We must use time wisely and forever realize that the time is always ripe to do right.
AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela

QUOTE: Time is the coin of your life. It is the only coin you have, and only you can determine how it will be spent. Be careful lest you let other people spend it for you.
AUTHOR: Carl Sandburg

QUOTE: Time has been transformed, and we have changed; it has advanced and set us in motion; it has unveiled its face, inspiring us with bewilderment and exhilaration.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: Waste your money and you're only out of money, but waste your time and you've lost a part of your life.
AUTHOR: Michael LeBoeuf

QUOTE: Yesterday's the past, tomorrow's the future, but today is a gift. That's why it's called the present.
AUTHOR: Bil Keane

QUOTE: Everything happens to everybody sooner or later if there is time enough.
AUTHOR: George Bernard Shaw

QUOTE: Time is but the stream I go a-fishing in.
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: Time is what we want most, but what we use worst.

QUOTE: You can never plan the future by the past.
AUTHOR: Edmund Burke

QUOTE: It is strange that the years teach us patience; that the shorter our time, the greater our capacity for waiting.
AUTHOR: Elizabeth Taylor

QUOTE: Time changes everything except something within us which is always surprised by change.
AUTHOR: Thomas Hardy

QUOTE: Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you will not do anything with it.
