QUOTE: People think I should be a success, but I'm afraid of it.
AUTHOR: Michael Reagan

QUOTE: With 'Believe' bringing really big success for me outside of the U.K. for the first time, it meant I have been touring around the world and that led to a gap from the studio. I really feel like the gap has done me the world of good. Throughout that time I was able to collect songs that I really loved.
AUTHOR: Katherine Jenkins

QUOTE: I don't want to wake up and be bored. That's probably my greatest fear is to have nothing to do. What better job is there than to play quarterback for an NFL team, and certainly one that I've been on for a long time and had success with? I don't plan on giving it up any time soon.
AUTHOR: Tom Brady

QUOTE: Everyone applauds each other's success in Hollywood because they know how tough it is, but it really comes down fundamentally to the process.
AUTHOR: Robert Rodriguez

QUOTE: If you can attribute your success entirely to your own mental effort, to your own attitude, to some spiritual essence that you have that is better than other people's, then that must feel pretty good.
AUTHOR: Barbara Ehrenreich

QUOTE: How does one measure the success of a museum?
AUTHOR: Paul Getty

QUOTE: I don't like Tommy on Broadway at all. I like the music, I'm pleased with Pete's success but I don't like what they've done to it.
AUTHOR: Roger Daltrey

QUOTE: I used to think that losing made you more hungry and determined but after my success at the Olympics and the U.S. Open I realise that winning is the biggest motivation.
AUTHOR: Andy Murray

QUOTE: Success for an athlete follows many years of hard work and dedication.
AUTHOR: Michael Diamond

QUOTE: It will, of course, be understood that directly or indirectly, soon or late, every advance in the sciences of human nature will contribute to our success in controlling human nature and changing it to the advantage of the common weal.
AUTHOR: Edward Thorndike

QUOTE: One thing that success has taught me is censorship.
AUTHOR: Tracey Emin

QUOTE: I came to America with a dream and I made it. The dream became reality. America is built for success.
AUTHOR: Jean Claude Van Damme

QUOTE: Success, and even life itself, wouldn't be worth anything if I didn't have my wife and children by my side. They mean everything to me.
AUTHOR: Jude Law

QUOTE: Hosting a TV show is a full-time job in which success is defined by it never ending.
AUTHOR: John Hodgman

QUOTE: Past performance speaks a tremendous amount about one's ability and likelihood for success.
AUTHOR: Mark Spitz

QUOTE: You should put time into learning your craft. It seems like people want success so quickly, way before they're ready.
AUTHOR: Lucinda Williams

QUOTE: Singing is my dream and, while it may have not been a commercial success, critically I was thrilled with the reception my first album got.
AUTHOR: Minnie Driver

QUOTE: I think that the entertainment industry itself has a history of chasing success. Any time a hit product comes out, all the other companies start chasing after that success and trying to recreate it by putting out similar products.
AUTHOR: Shigeru Miyamoto

QUOTE: The true success is the person who invented himself.
AUTHOR: Al Goldstein

QUOTE: The fame of heroes owes little to the extent of their conquests and all to the success of the tributes paid to them.
AUTHOR: Jean Genet

QUOTE: My first attempt at a kiss was in fifth grade, but it didn't go so well. Later, I used Boyz II Men and Jodeci songs to come on to girls. I had more success.
AUTHOR: John Legend

QUOTE: We now live in a world where the only thing to have is success, but failure is marvelous. It's fertiliser, it's like living fertiliser, because you're forced on yourself.
AUTHOR: Rupert Everett

QUOTE: I worked 18 years to become an overnight success. Now MagicPlace.com will short circuit that process for people.
AUTHOR: Criss Angel

QUOTE: If greater openness is a key to economic success, I believe there is increasingly a need for openness in the political sphere as well.
AUTHOR: Paul Wolfowitz

QUOTE: A sad fact of life lately at the Museum of Modern Art is that when it comes to group shows of contemporary painting from the collection, the bar has been set pretty low.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: The alchemy of good curating amounts to this: Sometimes, placing one work of art near another makes one plus one equal three. Two artworks arranged alchemically leave each intact, transform both, and create a third thing.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Everyone goes to the same exhibitions and the same parties, stays in the same handful of hotels, eats at the same no-star restaurants, and has almost the same opinions. I adore the art world, but this is copycat behavior in a sphere that prides itself on independent thinking.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Mission accomplished. The Museum of Modern Art's wide-open, tall-ceilinged, super-reinforced second floor was for all intents and purposes built to accommodate monumental installations and gigantic sculptures, should the need arise. It has arisen.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: 'Summer of Love: Art of the Psychedelic Era,' the Whitney Museum's 40th-anniversary trip down counterculture memory lane, provides moments of buzzy fun, but it'll leave you only comfortably numb. For starters, it may be the whitest, straightest, most conservative show seen in a New York museum since psychedelia was new.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: I love to collect modern art.
AUTHOR: Maria Sharapova

QUOTE: Those who love him love that he sells the most art; they take it as a point of faith that this proves Kinkade is the best. But his fans don't only rely on this supply-and-demand justification. They go back to values.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: The reason the art world doesn't respond to Kinkade is because none - not one - of his ideas about subject-matter, surface, color, composition, touch, scale, form, or skill is remotely original. They're all cliche and already told.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Kinkade's paintings are worthless schmaltz, and the lamestream media that love him are wrong. However, I'd love to see a museum mount a small show of Kinkade's work. I would like the art world and the wider world to argue about him in public, out in the open.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Auction houses run a rigged game. They know exactly how many people will be bidding on a work and exactly who they are. In a gallery, works of art need only one person who wants to pay for them.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Artschwager's art always involves looking closely at surfaces, questions what an object is, wants to make you forget the name of the thing you're looking at so that it might mushroom in your mind into something that triggers unexpected infinities.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Early-twentieth-century abstraction is art's version of Einstein's Theory of Relativity. It's the idea that changed everything everywhere: quickly, decisively, for good.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: The Metropolitan Museum of Art is unsurpassed at presenting more than 50 centuries of work. I go there constantly, seeing things over and over, better than I've ever seen them before.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: If the Frieze Art Fair catches on, I imagine at least two great things happening. First, we will once again have a huge art fair in town that isn't too annoying to go to. More importantly, Frieze may finally show New Yorkers that we can cross our own waters for visual culture. That would change everything.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Art is for anyone. It just isn't for everyone. Still, over the past decade, its audience has hugely grown, and that's irked those outside the art world, who get irritated at things like incomprehensibility or money.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: I often find myself privately stewing about much British art, thinking that except for their tremendous gardens, that the English are not primarily visual artists, and are, in nearly unsurpassable ways, literary.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: A metaphysical tour de force of untethered meaning and involuting interlocking contrapuntal rhythms, 'The Clock' is more than a movie or even a work of art. It is so strange and other-ish that it becomes a stream-of-consciousness algorithm unto itself - something almost inhuman.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: I don't know much about auctions. I sometimes go to previews and see art sardined into ugly rooms. I've gawked at the gaudy prices, and gaped at well-clad crowds of happy white people conspicuously spending hundreds of millions of dollars.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: I love art dealers. In some ways, they're my favorite people in the art world. Really. I love that they put their money where their taste is, create their own aesthetic universes, support artists, employ people, and do all of this while letting us see art for free. Many are visionaries.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: When museums are built these days, architects, directors, and trustees seem most concerned about social space: places to have parties, eat dinner, wine-and-dine donors. Sure, these are important these days - museums have to bring in money - but they gobble up space and push the art itself far away from the entrance.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: I see 30 to 40 gallery shows a week, and no matter what kind of mood I'm in, no matter how bad the art is, I almost always feel better afterward. I can learn as much from bad art as from good.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Jeffrey Deitch is the Jeff Koons of art dealers. Not because he's the biggest, best, or the richest of his kind. But because in some ways he's the weirdest (which is saying a lot when you're talking about the wonderful, wicked, lovable, and annoying creatures known as art dealers).
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Many say an art dealer running a museum is a 'conflict of interest.' But maybe the art world has lived an artificial or unintentional lie all of these years when it comes to conflicts of interest.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Of course art world ethics are important. But museums are no purer than any other institution or business. Academics aren't necessarily more high-minded than gallerists.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: We're all entitled to opinions about how art institutions should behave, and entitled to voicing those opinions through whatever means available to us. We're also allowed to change or modify our opinions.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Hope is like peace. It is not a gift from God. It is a gift only we can give one another.
AUTHOR: Elie Wiesel

QUOTE: Beware how you take away hope from another human being.
AUTHOR: Oliver Wendell Holmes

QUOTE: Hope will never be silent.
AUTHOR: Harvey Milk

QUOTE: The trouble with most people is that they think with their hopes or fears or wishes rather than with their minds.
AUTHOR: Will Durant

QUOTE: Things start out as hopes and end up as habits.
AUTHOR: Lillian Hellman

QUOTE: I have tried to keep on with my striving because this is the only hope I have of ever achieving anything worthwhile and lasting.
AUTHOR: Arthur Ashe

QUOTE: Uncertainty is the refuge of hope.
AUTHOR: Henri Frederic Amiel

QUOTE: I place no hope in my strength, nor in my works: but all my confidence is in God my protector, who never abandons those who have put all their hope and thought in him.
AUTHOR: Francois Rabelais

QUOTE: It's time to get real, folks. Hope and change ain't working. Hope and change is not a solution. Hope and change is not a job.
AUTHOR: Herman Cain

QUOTE: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
AUTHOR: Alexandre Dumas

QUOTE: All hope abandon, ye who enter here!
AUTHOR: Dante Alighieri

QUOTE: One lives in the hope of becoming a memory.
AUTHOR: Antonio Porchia

QUOTE: The world is bad but not without hope. It is only hopeless when you look at it from an ideal viewpoint.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Durrenmatt

QUOTE: How disappointment tracks the steps of hope.
AUTHOR: Letitia Elizabeth Landon

QUOTE: At the moment of death I hope to be surprised.
AUTHOR: Ivan Illich

QUOTE: I wish I could know everything ever, like that would be my wish - that's what I hope heaven is, that they tell you who shot JFK and all that stuff.
AUTHOR: Louis C. K.

QUOTE: There is hope in dreams, imagination, and in the courage of those who wish to make those dreams a reality.

QUOTE: All that I am, or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.
AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln

QUOTE: Any people anywhere, being inclined and having the power, have the right to rise up, and shake off the existing government, and form a new one that suits them better. This is a most valuable - a most sacred right - a right, which we hope and believe, is to liberate the world.
AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln

QUOTE: Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.
AUTHOR: Maya Angelou

QUOTE: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: I'm for truth, no matter who tells it. I'm for justice, no matter who it's for or against.
AUTHOR: Malcolm X

QUOTE: Our duty is to encourage every one in his struggle to live up to his own highest idea, and strive at the same time to make the ideal as near as possible to the Truth.
AUTHOR: Swami Vivekananda

QUOTE: All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns.
AUTHOR: Bruce Lee

QUOTE: Light is the symbol of truth.
AUTHOR: James Russell Lowell

QUOTE: Tell the children the truth.
AUTHOR: Bob Marley

QUOTE: Truth is beautiful, without doubt; but so are lies.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: Half a truth is often a great lie.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

QUOTE: Truth will ultimately prevail where there is pains to bring it to light.
AUTHOR: George Washington

QUOTE: Truth can be stated in a thousand different ways, yet each one can be true.
AUTHOR: Swami Vivekananda

QUOTE: The words of truth are always paradoxical.
AUTHOR: Lao Tzu

QUOTE: Plato is dear to me, but dearer still is truth.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: All credibility, all good conscience, all evidence of truth come only from the senses.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: On the mountains of truth you can never climb in vain: either you will reach a point higher up today, or you will be training your powers so that you will be able to climb higher tomorrow.

QUOTE: The truth will set you free, but first it will make you miserable.
AUTHOR: James A. Garfield

QUOTE: A lot of truth is said in jest.
AUTHOR: Eminem

QUOTE: Seek not greatness, but seek truth and you will find both.
AUTHOR: Horace Mann

QUOTE: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.
AUTHOR: Galileo Galilei

QUOTE: Stand upright, speak thy thoughts, declare The truth thou hast, that all may share; Be bold, proclaim it everywhere: They only live who dare.
AUTHOR: Voltaire

QUOTE: I have a theory that the truth is never told during the nine-to-five hours.
AUTHOR: Hunter S. Thompson

QUOTE: I believe that it is better to tell the truth than a lie. I believe it is better to be free than to be a slave. And I believe it is better to know than to be ignorant.
AUTHOR: H. L. Mencken

QUOTE: Experience has shown, and a true philosophy will always show, that a vast, perhaps the larger portion of the truth arises from the seemingly irrelevant.
AUTHOR: Edgar Allan Poe

QUOTE: The absurd is the essential concept and the first truth.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

AUTHOR: Hunter S. Thompson

QUOTE: Nature is not simply a technical or economical resource, and human beings are not mere numbers. To suggest that one can somehow align all the squabbling institutions of science, environmental management, government and diplomacy in an alliance of convenience to regulate the global climate seems to me optimistic.
AUTHOR: James Buchan

QUOTE: Human nature is such that people are born with a love of profit If they follow these inclinations, they will struggle and snatch from each other, and inclinations to defer or yield will die.
AUTHOR: Xun Zi

QUOTE: To make a love story, you need a couple of young people, but to reflect on the nature of love, you're better off with old ones. That is a fact of life and literature - and of the novel ever since it fell in love with love in the 18th century.
AUTHOR: James Buchan

QUOTE: Since the nature of people is bad, to become corrected they must be taught by teachers and to be orderly they must acquire ritual and moral principles.
AUTHOR: Xun Zi

QUOTE: I'm not sure I can explain the nature of Jack Kennedy's charm, but he took life just as it came.
AUTHOR: Gene Tierney

QUOTE: For the mind disturbed, the still beauty of dawn is nature's finest balm.
AUTHOR: Edwin Way Teale

AUTHOR: Ernest Shackleton

QUOTE: Given the eclectic and constantly shifting nature of my metaphysical inclinations, I will probably never feel certain exactly what an angel is.
AUTHOR: Martha Beck

QUOTE: Nature is the glass reflecting God, as by the sea reflected is the sun, too glorious to be gazed on in his sphere.
AUTHOR: Brigham Young

QUOTE: To know what that true self is without social pressure is to know your true nature.
AUTHOR: Martha Beck

QUOTE: I think people are isolated because of the nature of human consciousness, and they like it when they feel the connection between themselves and someone else.
AUTHOR: James Taylor

QUOTE: My job has always been to hold a mirror up to nature.
AUTHOR: Tom Hanks

QUOTE: The nature of motion capture is only going to work for certain films. It's not going to put any other type of movies out of business.

QUOTE: We'll be back to our nature documentary, 'Baggy the Anorexic Elephant' in just a second.

QUOTE: It is human nature to hate the man whom you have hurt.
AUTHOR: Tacitus

QUOTE: Faith is not a notion, but a real strong essential hunger, an attracting or magnetic desire of Christ, which as it proceeds from a seed of the divine nature in us, so it attracts and unites with its like.
AUTHOR: William Law

QUOTE: French is a foreign language, but I've been speaking it since I was 18 so it's second nature to me.
AUTHOR: Kristin Scott Thomas

QUOTE: I've probably understood men too well. I realise they are predatory by nature, and I have a certain acceptance of the male animal.
AUTHOR: Jacqueline Bisset

QUOTE: Quantum computation is... a distinctively new way of harnessing nature... It will be the first technology that allows useful tasks to be performed in collaboration between parallel universes.
AUTHOR: David Deutsch

QUOTE: Like a great poet, Nature knows how to produce the greatest effects with the most limited means.
AUTHOR: Heinrich Heine

QUOTE: The knower and the known are one. Simple people imagine that they should see God as if he stood there and they here. This is not so. God and I, we are one in knowledge.

QUOTE: The ability to perceive or think differently is more important than the knowledge gained.

QUOTE: To be educated, a person doesn't have to know much or be informed, but he or she does have to have been exposed vulnerably to the transformative events of an engaged human life.

QUOTE: We live on an island surrounded by a sea of ignorance. As our island of knowledge grows, so does the shore of our ignorance.

QUOTE: Knowledge is the life of the mind.

QUOTE: When a man's knowledge is not in order, the more of it he has the greater will be his confusion.

QUOTE: If you first fortify yourself with the true knowledge of the Universal Self, and then live in the midst of wealth and worldliness, surely they will in no way affect you.

QUOTE: Without self knowledge, without understanding the working and functions of his machine, man cannot be free, he cannot govern himself and he will always remain a slave.

QUOTE: Knowledge is the eye of desire and can become the pilot of the soul.

QUOTE: I think we risk becoming the best informed society that has ever died of ignorance.

QUOTE: Every addition to true knowledge is an addition to human power.

QUOTE: It is one of my sources of happiness never to desire a knowledge of other people's business.

QUOTE: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.

QUOTE: The knowledge of yourself will preserve you from vanity.

QUOTE: Never stop learning; knowledge doubles every fourteen months.

QUOTE: A man of knowledge lives by acting, not by thinking about acting.

QUOTE: Having knowledge but lacking the power to express it clearly is no better than never having any ideas at all.

QUOTE: I'll come to you with gifts of knowledge, wisdom and truth.

QUOTE: To know what you know and what you do not know, that is true knowledge.

QUOTE: Knowledge is soon changed, then lost in the mist, an echo half-heard.

QUOTE: So during those first moments of the day, which are yours and yours alone, you can circumvent these boundaries and concentrate fully on spiritual matters. And this gives you the opportunity to plan the time management of the entire day.

QUOTE: Both young children and old people have a lot of time on their hands. That's probably why they get along so well.

QUOTE: Well-timed silence is the most commanding expression.

QUOTE: I confess, I do not believe in time.

QUOTE: Lost wealth may be replaced by industry, lost knowledge by study, lost health by temperance or medicine, but lost time is gone forever.

QUOTE: Time makes heroes but dissolves celebrities.

QUOTE: My time is now.

QUOTE: Time is the wisest counselor of all.
AUTHOR: Pericles

QUOTE: Time is the father of truth, its mother is our mind.

QUOTE: Time is the school in which we learn, time is the fire in which we burn.

QUOTE: And when is there time to remember, to sift, to weigh, to estimate, to total?

QUOTE: We have not the time to take our time.

QUOTE: Time goes, you say? Ah, no! alas, time stays, we go.

QUOTE: I took some time out for life.

QUOTE: The best way to fill time is to waste it.

QUOTE: When in doubt, take more time.

QUOTE: If I have made an appointment with you, I owe you punctuality, I have no right to throw away your time, if I do my own.

QUOTE: Time is a beautiful thing. It's like when you meet an old lover on the street six years later and they don't look so ugly anymore.

QUOTE: Time was God's first creation.

QUOTE: Time is a dressmaker specializing in alterations.

QUOTE: There's time enough, but none to spare.

QUOTE: O sweet, delusive Noon, Which the morning climbs to find, O moment sped too soon, And morning left behind.

QUOTE: The present is a point just passed.

QUOTE: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.

QUOTE: It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.

QUOTE: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.

QUOTE: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.

QUOTE: The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend.

QUOTE: In every adversity there lies the seed of an equivalent advantage. In every defeat is a lesson showing you how to win the victory next time.

QUOTE: For a long time, I thought I was ugly and disfigured. This made me shy and timid, and I often reacted to insults that were not intended.

QUOTE: The single most important thing in a child's performance is the quality of the teacher. Making sure a child spends the maximum amount of time with inspirational teachers is the most important thing.

AUTHOR: Mitt Romney

QUOTE: When I woke up Sunday morning at the Open and stepped outside and felt the wind and rain in my face, I knew I had an excellent chance to win if I just took my time and trusted myself.

AUTHOR: Fidel Castro

QUOTE: I like to do weird things in the shower, like drink my coffee, brush my teeth and drink a smoothie. It's good time management.

QUOTE: Most quarrels are inevitable at the time; incredible afterwards.

QUOTE: Only married people understand you can be miserable and happy at the same time.

QUOTE: A conservative believes nothing should be done for the first time.

QUOTE: When you have your heart broken for the first time, you gain depth.

QUOTE: Man is always more than he can know of himself; consequently, his accomplishments, time and again, will come as a surprise to him.

QUOTE: Every step of life shows much caution is required.

QUOTE: I don't get a chance to be home much.

Like a true Italian, she valued beautification in every area of her life, and I try to do the same.

QUOTE: Beautiful isle of the sea, Smile on the brow of the waters.

QUOTE: When we long for life without difficulties, remind us that oaks grow strong in contrary winds and diamonds are made under pressure.

QUOTE: When adversity strikes, that's when you have to be the most calm. Take a step back, stay strong, stay grounded and press on.
AUTHOR: LL Cool J

QUOTE: Anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strength.
AUTHOR: Charles Spurgeon

QUOTE: What is exciting is not for one person to be stronger than the other... but for two people to have met their match and yet they are equally as stubborn, as obstinate, as passionate, as crazy as the other.
AUTHOR: Barbra Streisand

QUOTE: A truly strong person does not need the approval of others any more than a lion needs the approval of sheep.
AUTHOR: Vernon Howard

QUOTE: Don't wait for extraordinary opportunities. Seize common occasions and make them great. Weak men wait for opportunities; strong men make them.
AUTHOR: Orison Swett Marden

QUOTE: Nothing is so strong as gentleness, nothing so gentle as real strength.
AUTHOR: Saint Francis de Sales

QUOTE: Because your own strength is unequal to the task, do not assume that it is beyond the powers of man; but if anything is within the powers and province of man, believe that it is within your own compass also.
AUTHOR: Marcus Aurelius

QUOTE: Only the gentle are ever really strong.
AUTHOR: James Dean

QUOTE: Rudeness is a weak imitation of strength.
AUTHOR: Eric Hoffer

QUOTE: In all my perplexities and distresses, the Bible has never failed to give me light and strength.
AUTHOR: Robert E. Lee

QUOTE: A single twig breaks, but the bundle of twigs is strong.
AUTHOR: Tecumseh

QUOTE: The strong man is the one who is able to intercept at will the communication between the senses and the mind.
AUTHOR: Napoleon Bonaparte

QUOTE: There are dark shadows on the earth, but its lights are stronger in the contrast.
AUTHOR: Charles Dickens

QUOTE: There are two ways of exerting one's strength: one is pushing down, the other is pulling up.
AUTHOR: Booker T. Washington

QUOTE: If your determination is fixed, I do not counsel you to despair. Few things are impossible to diligence and skill. Great works are performed not by strength, but perseverance.
AUTHOR: Samuel Johnson

QUOTE: Strength is the capacity to break a chocolate bar into four pieces with your bare hands - and then eat just one of the pieces.
AUTHOR: Judith Viorst

QUOTE: Only by contending with challenges that seem to be beyond your strength to handle at the moment you can grow more surely toward the stars.
AUTHOR: Brian Tracy

QUOTE: A man's character may be learned from the adjectives which he habitually uses in conversation.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Truthful words are not beautiful; beautiful words are not truthful. Good words are not persuasive; persuasive words are not good.
AUTHOR: Lao Tzu

QUOTE: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
AUTHOR: George Bernard Shaw

QUOTE: Words are only painted fire; a look is the fire itself.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: You can change your world by changing your words... Remember, death and life are in the power of the tongue.
AUTHOR: Joel Osteen

QUOTE: Any problem, big or small, within a family, always seems to start with bad communication. Someone isn't listening.
AUTHOR: Emma Thompson

QUOTE: Electric communication will never be a substitute for the face of someone who with their soul encourages another person to be brave and true.
AUTHOR: Charles Dickens

QUOTE: By and large, language is a tool for concealing the truth.
AUTHOR: George Carlin

QUOTE: Take advantage of every opportunity to practice your communication skills so that when important occasions arise, you will have the gift, the style, the sharpness, the clarity, and the emotions to affect other people.
AUTHOR: Jim Rohn

QUOTE: The most important thing in communication is hearing what isn't said.
AUTHOR: Peter Drucker

QUOTE: I'm a great believer that any tool that enhances communication has profound effects in terms of how people can learn from each other, and how they can achieve the kind of freedoms that they're interested in.
AUTHOR: Bill Gates

QUOTE: To effectively communicate, we must realize that we are all different in the way we perceive the world and use this understanding as a guide to our communication with others.
AUTHOR: Tony Robbins

QUOTE: I learned never to empty the well of my writing, but always to stop when there was still something there in the deep part of the well, and let it refill at night from the springs that fed it.
AUTHOR: Ernest Hemingway

QUOTE: Of all of our inventions for mass communication, pictures still speak the most universally understood language.
AUTHOR: Walt Disney

QUOTE: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.
AUTHOR: Epictetus

QUOTE: Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot.
AUTHOR: David Herbert Lawrence

QUOTE: Every day I try to be in communication with the universe in an unconscious way.
AUTHOR: Paulo Coelho

QUOTE: The game of life is a game of boomerangs. Our thoughts, deeds and words return to us sooner or later with astounding accuracy.
AUTHOR: Florence Scovel Shinn

QUOTE: Man is a creature who lives not upon bread alone, but primarily by catchwords.
AUTHOR: Robert Louis Stevenson

QUOTE: Photography is more than a medium for factual communication of ideas. It is a creative art.
AUTHOR: Ansel Adams

QUOTE: Genius is the ability to put into effect what is on your mind.
AUTHOR: F. Scott Fitzgerald

QUOTE: Communication - the human connection - is the key to personal and career success.
AUTHOR: Paul J. Meyer

QUOTE: Bad human communication leaves us less room to grow.
AUTHOR: Rowan D. Williams

QUOTE: You have to understand the tone of the movie, because if it's supposed to be funny, it can be funny violent like the Home Alone stuff, but you have to really understand the tone of what you're doing and make the action work for that and for the character.
AUTHOR: David R. Ellis

QUOTE: I was the class clown at school, but at home, my family wasn't very funny.
AUTHOR: Carrot Top

QUOTE: I don't sit down to write a funny story. Every single thing I sit down to write is meant to be sad.
AUTHOR: Lorrie Moore

QUOTE: Do you know anything that in all its innocence is more humiliating than the funny pages of a Sunday newspaper in America?
AUTHOR: Johan Huizinga

QUOTE: I've never been to a dinner party where everyone at the dinner table didn't say something funny.
AUTHOR: Lorrie Moore

QUOTE: You know, I'm just a very boring, not very funny person in person. I don't feel pressured to be otherwise.
AUTHOR: Lorrie Moore

QUOTE: Being funny with a funny voice is more my comfort zone, a broader character that I try to humanize, a kind of silly or wacky persona that I try to fill in.
AUTHOR: Hank Azaria

QUOTE: I'm not a comedian. I'm an actor who just happens to be funny on occasion.
AUTHOR: Anthony Anderson

QUOTE: I believe, in a funny way, the job of the novelist is to be out there on the fringes and speaking for an experience that has not really been spoken for.
AUTHOR: Donna Tartt

QUOTE: It's funny, but when I arrived in California to start college I was much more interested in becoming a surfer and cruise along in life from one beach to the next. I didn't plan out any huge career for myself.
AUTHOR: Benicio Del Toro

QUOTE: If it gets laughs, it's funny.
AUTHOR: Rachel Dratch

QUOTE: It's funny to have become an elegant skier now. But my drive is still the same.
AUTHOR: Hermann Maier

QUOTE: Many comedians have a dark side that lets them take a negative thing and turn it funny.
AUTHOR: Rachel Dratch

QUOTE: One longs to be funny, to make people laugh. Laughter is such a sign of approval, isn't it?
AUTHOR: Tom Baker

QUOTE: It's funny, in literature no one ever goes to the lavatory.
AUTHOR: Tom Baker

QUOTE: If you can find the line between sympathetic and creepy, you have reached a very funny area.
AUTHOR: Jason Segel

QUOTE: So far, at least, I haven't found a way to tell my kind of stories without making them both sad and funny.
AUTHOR: Todd Solondz

QUOTE: It's funny, because I did all of these interviews as soon as I had the baby, and they were asking questions, and I really didn't have an idea of anything, because I was so blurry.
AUTHOR: Emily Procter

QUOTE: It's funny, in a way the actor is a writer. It's not like the two things are so separate as to be like apples and oranges. The writer and the actor are one.
AUTHOR: Sam Shepard

QUOTE: I've always thought those guys are really funny. And I love Dumb and Dumber, Kingpin and Mary.
AUTHOR: David Zucker

QUOTE: Wikipedia is just an incredible thing. It is fact-encirclingly huge, and it is idiosyncratic, careful, messy, funny, shocking and full of simmering controversies - and it is free, and it is fast.
AUTHOR: Nicholson Baker

QUOTE: I don't think of myself as a comedian, but as an artist, a scientist and chemist who just happens to be funny. I started doing stand-up to add another level to my game. I feel that I'm a young rookie with a veteran's skill.
AUTHOR: Marlon Wayans

QUOTE: What's funny about that is when I was writing Twilight just for myself and not thinking of it as a book, I was not thinking about publishing, and yet at the same time I was casting it in my head. Because when I read books, I see them very visually.
AUTHOR: Stephenie Meyer

QUOTE: When it comes to war, we focus more on the mainstream coverage of the event, rather than the event itself. People dying is never funny. Protest puppets are always funny.
AUTHOR: Mo Rocca

QUOTE: I allow a lot of room for improvisation and funny stuff. I always feel planned.
AUTHOR: Michael Bay

QUOTE: God grant me the courage not to give up what I think is right even though I think it is hopeless.
AUTHOR: Chester W. Nimitz

QUOTE: I simply can't build my hopes on a foundation of confusion, misery and death... I think... peace and tranquillity will return again.
AUTHOR: Anne Frank

QUOTE: A strong mind always hopes, and has always cause to hope.
AUTHOR: Thomas Carlyle

QUOTE: Chance has never yet satisfied the hope of a suffering people.
AUTHOR: Marcus Garvey

QUOTE: In this world you've just got to hope for the best and prepare for the worst and take whatever God sends.
AUTHOR: Lucy Maud Montgomery

QUOTE: Hope springs eternal in the human breast: Man never is, but always To be Blest.
AUTHOR: Alexander Pope

QUOTE: When we have lost everything, including hope, life becomes a disgrace, and death a duty.
AUTHOR: W. C. Fields

QUOTE: I said to my soul, be still, and wait without hope, For hope would be hope for the wrong thing.
AUTHOR: T. S. Eliot

QUOTE: Where there is no vision, there is no hope.
AUTHOR: George Washington Carver

QUOTE: A whole stack of memories never equal one little hope.
AUTHOR: Charles M. Schulz

QUOTE: Every day begins with an act of courage and hope: getting out of bed.
AUTHOR: Mason Cooley

QUOTE: Hope is the last thing a person does before they are defeated.
AUTHOR: Henry Rollins

QUOTE: At the end of the day, we must go forward with hope and not backward by fear and division.
AUTHOR: Jesse Jackson

QUOTE: Expecting something for nothing is the most popular form of hope.
AUTHOR: Arnold H. Glasow

QUOTE: Hope is the only universal liar who never loses his reputation for veracity.
AUTHOR: Robert Green Ingersoll

QUOTE: Hope is a good breakfast, but it is a bad supper.
AUTHOR: Francis Bacon

QUOTE: My hope still is to leave the world a bit better than when I got here.
AUTHOR: Jim Henson

QUOTE: To live without Hope is to Cease to live.
AUTHOR: Fyodor Dostoevsky

QUOTE: It is only hope which is real, and reality is a bitterness and a deceit.
AUTHOR: William Makepeace Thackeray

QUOTE: Hopeful thinking can get you out of your fear zone and into your appreciation zone.
AUTHOR: Martha Beck

QUOTE: Hope is like the sun, which, as we journey toward it, casts the shadow of our burden behind us.
AUTHOR: Samuel Smiles

QUOTE: I hope that I may always desire more than I can accomplish.
AUTHOR: Michelangelo

QUOTE: Don't give up. Don't lose hope. Don't sell out.
AUTHOR: Christopher Reeve

QUOTE: The work goes on, the cause endures, the hope still lives and the dreams shall never die.
AUTHOR: Edward Kennedy

QUOTE: A soldier will fight long and hard for a bit of colored ribbon.
AUTHOR: Napoleon Bonaparte

QUOTE: War is an ugly thing, but not the ugliest of things. The decayed and degraded state of moral and patriotic feeling which thinks that nothing is worth war is much worse.
AUTHOR: John Stuart Mill

QUOTE: There will one day spring from the brain of science a machine or force so fearful in its potentialities, so absolutely terrifying, that even man, the fighter, who will dare torture and death in order to inflict torture and death, will be appalled, and so abandon war forever.
AUTHOR: Thomas A. Edison

QUOTE: There is no avoiding war; it can only be postponed to the advantage of others.
AUTHOR: Niccolo Machiavelli

QUOTE: Yesterday, December seventh, 1941, a date which will live in infamy, the United States of America was suddenly and deliberately attacked by naval and air forces of the Empire of Japan. We will gain the inevitable triumph, so help us God.
AUTHOR: Franklin D. Roosevelt

QUOTE: In peace, sons bury their fathers. In war, fathers bury their sons.
AUTHOR: Herodotus

QUOTE: War grows out of the desire of the individual to gain advantage at the expense of his fellow man.
AUTHOR: Napoleon Hill

QUOTE: You can't say civilization don't advance... in every war they kill you in a new way.
AUTHOR: Will Rogers

QUOTE: I'm fed up to the ears with old men dreaming up wars for young men to die in.
AUTHOR: George McGovern

QUOTE: Patriots always talk of dying for their country and never of killing for their country.
AUTHOR: Bertrand Russell

QUOTE: It is well that war is so terrible. We should grow too fond of it.
AUTHOR: Robert E. Lee

QUOTE: Only the dead have seen the end of the war.
AUTHOR: George Santayana

QUOTE: In my dreams I hear again the crash of guns, the rattle of musketry, the strange, mournful mutter of the battlefield.
AUTHOR: Douglas MacArthur

QUOTE: We are going to have peace even if we have to fight for it.
AUTHOR: Dwight D. Eisenhower

QUOTE: To walk through the ruined cities of Germany is to feel an actual doubt about the continuity of civilization.
AUTHOR: George Orwell

QUOTE: Wars have never hurt anybody except the people who die.

QUOTE: Ours is a world of nuclear giants and ethical infants. We know more about war that we know about peace, more about killing that we know about living.

QUOTE: All wars are civil wars, because all men are brothers.
AUTHOR: Francois Fenelon

QUOTE: Ten soldiers wisely led will beat a hundred without a head.
AUTHOR: Euripides

QUOTE: War is a defeat for humanity.
AUTHOR: Pope John Paul II

QUOTE: The military don't start wars. Politicians start wars.
AUTHOR: William Westmoreland

QUOTE: An unjust peace is better than a just war.
AUTHOR: Marcus Tullius Cicero

QUOTE: Older men declare war. But it is the youth that must fight and die.

QUOTE: War is not an adventure. It is a disease. It is like typhus.
AUTHOR: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

QUOTE: Sometime they'll give a war and nobody will come.
AUTHOR: Carl Sandburg

QUOTE: May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view. May your mountains rise into and above the clouds.
AUTHOR: Edward Abbey

QUOTE: Birds sing after a storm; why shouldn't people feel as free to delight in whatever remains to them?
AUTHOR: Rose Kennedy

QUOTE: Delicious autumn! My very soul is wedded to it, and if I were a bird I would fly about the earth seeking the successive autumns.
AUTHOR: George Eliot

QUOTE: It is not so much for its beauty that the forest makes a claim upon men's hearts, as for that subtle something, that quality of air that emanation from old trees, that so wonderfully changes and renews a weary spirit.
AUTHOR: Robert Louis Stevenson

QUOTE: Rest is not idleness, and to lie sometimes on the grass under trees on a summer's day, listening to the murmur of the water, or watching the clouds float across the sky, is by no means a waste of time.

QUOTE: Trees are the earth's endless effort to speak to the listening heaven.
AUTHOR: Rabindranath Tagore

QUOTE: I believe in God, only I spell it Nature.

QUOTE: Don't knock the weather; nine-tenths of the people couldn't start a conversation if it didn't change once in a while.

QUOTE: I think it pisses God off if you walk by the color purple in a field somewhere and don't notice it.

QUOTE: I believe a leaf of grass is no less than the journey-work of the stars.
AUTHOR: Walt Whitman

QUOTE: Everything is blooming most recklessly; if it were voices instead of colors, there would be an unbelievable shrieking into the heart of the night.

QUOTE: The sun, with all those planets revolving around it and dependent on it, can still ripen a bunch of grapes as if it had nothing else in the universe to do.

QUOTE: The world is mud-luscious and puddle-wonderful.
AUTHOR: e. e. cummings

QUOTE: A morning-glory at my window satisfies me more than the metaphysics of books.

QUOTE: Give me odorous at sunrise a garden of beautiful flowers where I can walk undisturbed.
AUTHOR: Walt Whitman

QUOTE: What is the good of your stars and trees, your sunrise and the wind, if they do not enter into our daily lives?

QUOTE: What would be ugly in a garden constitutes beauty in a mountain.

QUOTE: Some people walk in the rain, others just get wet.

QUOTE: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
AUTHOR: John Muir

QUOTE: A hen is only an egg's way of making another egg.

QUOTE: Earth and sky, woods and fields, lakes and rivers, the mountain and the sea, are excellent schoolmasters, and teach some of us more than we can ever learn from books.

QUOTE: Reading about nature is fine, but if a person walks in the woods and listens carefully, he can learn more than what is in books, for they speak with the voice of God.

QUOTE: There is nothing in a caterpillar that tells you it's going to be a butterfly.
AUTHOR: R. Buckminster Fuller

QUOTE: As the poet said, 'Only God can make a tree,' probably because it's so hard to figure out how to get the bark on.

QUOTE: I like your Christ, I do not like your Christians. Your Christians are so unlike your Christ.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness.
AUTHOR: Dalai Lama

QUOTE: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.
AUTHOR: C. S. Lewis

QUOTE: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither.
AUTHOR: C. S. Lewis

QUOTE: I would rather live my life as if there is a God and die to find out there isn't, than live my life as if there isn't and die to find out there is.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: There is no need for temples, no need for complicated philosophies. My brain and my heart are my temples; my philosophy is kindness.
AUTHOR: Dalai Lama

QUOTE: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.
AUTHOR: Buddha

QUOTE: You cannot believe in God until you believe in yourself.
AUTHOR: Swami Vivekananda

QUOTE: Morality is of the highest importance - but for us, not for God.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: I love you when you bow in your mosque, kneel in your temple, pray in your church. For you and I are sons of one religion, and it is the spirit.

QUOTE: Our prayers should be for blessings in general, for God knows best what is good for us.

QUOTE: It is wonderful how much time good people spend fighting the devil. If they would only expend the same amount of energy loving their fellow men, the devil would die in his own tracks of ennui.

QUOTE: A thorough knowledge of the Bible is worth more than a college education.
AUTHOR: Theodore Roosevelt

QUOTE: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
AUTHOR: Meister Eckhart

QUOTE: Religion is what keeps the poor from murdering the rich.
AUTHOR: Napoleon Bonaparte

QUOTE: Rivers, ponds, lakes and streams - they all have different names, but they all contain water. Just as religions do - they all contain truths.

QUOTE: It's wonderful to climb the liquid mountains of the sky. Behind me and before me is God and I have no fears.

QUOTE: Preach the Gospel at all times and when necessary use words.
AUTHOR: Francis of Assisi

QUOTE: When the missionaries came to Africa they had the Bible and we had the land. They said 'Let us pray.' We closed our eyes. When we opened them we had the Bible and they had the land.

QUOTE: Prayer does not change God, but it changes him who prays.
AUTHOR: Soren Kierkegaard

QUOTE: The World is my country, all mankind are my brethren, and to do good is my religion.
AUTHOR: Thomas Paine

QUOTE: God is a metaphor for that which transcends all levels of intellectual thought. It's as simple as that.
AUTHOR: Joseph Campbell

QUOTE: If the grandfather of the grandfather of Jesus had known what was hidden within him, he would have stood humble and awe-struck before his soul.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use.
AUTHOR: Galileo Galilei

QUOTE: Crave for a thing, you will get it. Renounce the craving, the object will follow you by itself.
AUTHOR: Swami Sivananda

QUOTE: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.
AUTHOR: Woodrow Wilson

QUOTE: Only the educated are free.
AUTHOR: Epictetus

QUOTE: Fear cannot be without hope nor hope without fear.
AUTHOR: Baruch Spinoza

QUOTE: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
AUTHOR: Walter Elliot

QUOTE: Go big or go home. Because it's true. What do you have to lose?
AUTHOR: Eliza Dushku

QUOTE: I can, therefore I am.
AUTHOR: Simone Weil

QUOTE: In motivating people, you've got to engage their minds and their hearts. I motivate people, I hope, by example - and perhaps by excitement, by having productive ideas to make others feel involved.
AUTHOR: Rupert Murdoch

QUOTE: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
AUTHOR: Jack London

QUOTE: No matter how many goals you have achieved, you must set your sights on a higher one.
AUTHOR: Jessica Savitch

QUOTE: Wherever you are - be all there.
AUTHOR: Jim Elliot

QUOTE: Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.
AUTHOR: Peter Marshall

QUOTE: I've found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances. Be more active. Show up more often.
AUTHOR: Brian Tracy

QUOTE: To be a good loser is to learn how to win.
AUTHOR: Carl Sandburg

QUOTE: I learned that we can do anything, but we can't do everything... at least not at the same time. So think of your priorities not in terms of what activities you do, but when you do them. Timing is everything.
AUTHOR: Dan Millman

QUOTE: Without hard work, nothing grows but weeds.
AUTHOR: Gordon B. Hinckley

QUOTE: If you've got a talent, protect it.
AUTHOR: Jim Carrey

QUOTE: You can't expect to hit the jackpot if you don't put a few nickels in the machine.
AUTHOR: Flip Wilson

QUOTE: The wise does at once what the fool does at last.
AUTHOR: Baltasar Gracian

QUOTE: I really believe that everyone has a talent, ability, or skill that he can mine to support himself and to succeed in life.
AUTHOR: Dean Koontz

QUOTE: The will to succeed is important, but what's more important is the will to prepare.
AUTHOR: Bobby Knight

QUOTE: Be thine own palace, or the world's thy jail.
AUTHOR: John Donne

QUOTE: Poverty was the greatest motivating factor in my life.
AUTHOR: Jimmy Dean

QUOTE: The ultimate aim of the ego is not to see something, but to be something.
AUTHOR: Muhammad Iqbal

QUOTE: If we ever forget that we are One Nation Under God, then we will be a nation gone under.
AUTHOR: Ronald Reagan

QUOTE: Nationalism is an infantile disease. It is the measles of mankind.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, that we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty.
AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy

QUOTE: Patriot: the person who can holler the loudest without knowing what he is hollering about.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Patriotism is the virtue of the vicious.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: You're not supposed to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who says it.
AUTHOR: Malcolm X

QUOTE: Patriotism is your conviction that this country is superior to all others because you were born in it.
AUTHOR: George Bernard Shaw

QUOTE: It is lamentable, that to be a good patriot one must become the enemy of the rest of mankind.
AUTHOR: Voltaire

QUOTE: 137 years later, Memorial Day remains one of America's most cherished patriotic observances. The spirit of this day has not changed - it remains a day to honor those who died defending our freedom and democracy.
AUTHOR: Doc Hastings

QUOTE: We, the People, recognize that we have responsibilities as well as rights; that our destinies are bound together; that a freedom which only asks what's in it for me, a freedom without a commitment to others, a freedom without love or charity or duty or patriotism, is unworthy of our founding ideals, and those who died in their defense.
AUTHOR: Barack Obama

QUOTE: True patriotism hates injustice in its own land more than anywhere else.
AUTHOR: Clarence Darrow

QUOTE: Each nation feels superior to other nations. That breeds patriotism - and wars.
AUTHOR: Dale Carnegie

QUOTE: One of the great attractions of patriotism - it fulfills our worst wishes. In the person of our nation we are able, vicariously, to bully and cheat. Bully and cheat, what's more, with a feeling that we are profoundly virtuous.
AUTHOR: Aldous Huxley

QUOTE: Patriotism is easy to understand in America. It means looking out for yourself by looking out for your country.
AUTHOR: Calvin Coolidge

QUOTE: Can anything be stupider than that a man has the right to kill me because he lives on the other side of a river and his ruler has a quarrel with mine, though I have not quarrelled with him?
AUTHOR: Blaise Pascal

QUOTE: Patriotism is the willingness to kill and be killed for trivial reasons.
AUTHOR: Bertrand Russell

QUOTE: Patriotism is usually stronger than class hatred, and always stronger than internationalism.
AUTHOR: George Orwell

QUOTE: The highest patriotism is not a blind acceptance of official policy, but a love of one's country deep enough to call her to a higher plain.
AUTHOR: George McGovern

QUOTE: The greater the state, the more wrong and cruel its patriotism, and the greater is the sum of suffering upon which its power is founded.
AUTHOR: Leo Tolstoy

QUOTE: Our government has kept us in a perpetual state of fear - kept us in a continuous stampede of patriotic fervor - with the cry of grave national emergency.
AUTHOR: Douglas MacArthur

QUOTE: Patriotism is the last refuge of the scoundrel.
AUTHOR: Samuel Johnson

QUOTE: Patriotism is when love of your own people comes first; nationalism, when hate for people other than your own comes first.
AUTHOR: Charles de Gaulle

QUOTE: A real patriot is the fellow who gets a parking ticket and rejoices that the system works.
AUTHOR: Bill Vaughan

QUOTE: No matter that patriotism is too often the refuge of scoundrels. Dissent, rebellion, and all-around hell-raising remain the true duty of patriots.
AUTHOR: Barbara Ehrenreich

QUOTE: There is no such thing as a long piece of work, except one that you dare not start.
AUTHOR: Charles Baudelaire

QUOTE: It is necessary to work, if not from inclination, at least from despair. Everything considered, work is less boring than amusing oneself.
AUTHOR: Charles Baudelaire

QUOTE: Amidst all the clutter, beyond all the obstacles, aside from all the static, are the goals set. Put your head down, do the best job possible, let the flak pass, and work towards those goals.
AUTHOR: Donald Rumsfeld

QUOTE: Drugs will have a huge effect on my work for the rest of my life, whether I'm using or not.
AUTHOR: Layne Staley

QUOTE: The highest compliment that you can pay me is to say that I work hard every day, that I never dog it.
AUTHOR: Wayne Gretzky

QUOTE: So there's no such thing as work-life balance. There's work, and there's life, and there's no balance.
AUTHOR: Sheryl Sandberg

QUOTE: A woman can be very beautiful and an ideal model and she will photograph incredibly well, but she'll appear in film and it won't work. What works is some fusion of physical beauty with some mental field or whatever you call it. I don't know.
AUTHOR: Oliver Stone

QUOTE: There are two kinds of talent, man-made talent and God-given talent. With man-made talent you have to work very hard. With God-given talent, you just touch it up once in a while.

QUOTE: Knowledge, the object of knowledge and the knower are the three factors which motivate action; the senses, the work and the doer comprise the threefold basis of action.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Schiller

QUOTE: Nobody's a natural. You work hard to get good and then work to get better. It's hard to stay on top.
AUTHOR: Paul Coffey

QUOTE: Rumors sound of galleries asking artists for upsized art and more of it. I've heard of photographers asked to print larger to increase the wall power and salability of their work. Everything winds up set to maximum in order to feed the beast.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: What I learned growing up on the farm was a way of life that was centered on hard work, and on faith and on thrift. Those values have stuck with me my whole life.
AUTHOR: Rick Perry

QUOTE: You're basing your laws and your whole outlook on natural life on mythology. It won't work. That's why you have all these problems in the world. Name them: India, Pakistan, Ireland. Name them-all these problems. They're all religious problems.
AUTHOR: Jack Kevorkian

QUOTE: My work is a game, a very serious game.
AUTHOR: M. C. Escher

QUOTE: Let us realize that: the privilege to work is a gift, the power to work is a blessing, the love of work is success!
AUTHOR: David O. McKay

QUOTE: Generally a chef's book is like a calling card or a portfolio to display their personal work.
AUTHOR: Sally Schneider

QUOTE: I don't know why we work, my husband and I. We just do. We are black and white - yin and yang.
AUTHOR: Heidi Klum

QUOTE: Finding the right work is like discovering your own soul in the world.
AUTHOR: Thomas Moore

QUOTE: All I do, really, is go to work and try to be professional, be on time and be prepared.
AUTHOR: Ben Affleck

QUOTE: I just want to make sure I have a sense of balance between work and life, because work is my life and the lines can get really blurry.
AUTHOR: Drew Barrymore

QUOTE: I'm just learning who I am and how relationships work and how to make them function. No different from anyone else.
AUTHOR: Drew Barrymore

QUOTE: You should always be well and bright, for so you do your best work; and you have so much beautiful work to do. The world needs it, and you must give it!
AUTHOR: Marie Corelli

QUOTE: Whatever you do, do it with all your might. Work at it, early and late, in season and out of season, not leaving a stone unturned, and never deferring for a single hour that which can be done just as well now.
AUTHOR: P. T. Barnum

QUOTE: Yes, I, well, when I write, as often as I can, I try to write as if I'm talking to people. It doesn't always work, and one shouldn't always try it, but I try and write as if I am talking, and trying to engage the reader in conversation.
AUTHOR: Christopher Hitchens

QUOTE: Too much work, too much vacation, too much of any one thing is unsound.
AUTHOR: Walter Annenberg

QUOTE: A lot of people do not muster the courage to live their dreams because they are afraid to die.
AUTHOR: Les Brown

QUOTE: One man with courage makes a majority.
AUTHOR: Andrew Jackson

QUOTE: I'm grateful to God for His bountiful gifts... He gave me courage and faith in myself.
AUTHOR: Loretta Young

QUOTE: The courage to be is the courage to accept oneself, in spite of being unacceptable.
AUTHOR: Paul Tillich

QUOTE: A great deal of talent is lost to the world for want of a little courage. Every day sends to their graves obscure men whose timidity prevented them from making a first effort.
AUTHOR: Sydney Smith

QUOTE: Courage is being afraid but going on anyhow.
AUTHOR: Dan Rather

QUOTE: If you are lucky enough to find a way of life you love, you have to find the courage to live it.
AUTHOR: John Irving

QUOTE: It is only necessary to have courage, for strength without self-confidence is useless.
AUTHOR: Giacomo Casanova

QUOTE: Courage is found in unlikely places.
AUTHOR: J. R. R. Tolkien

QUOTE: Courage - a perfect sensibility of the measure of danger, and a mental willingness to endure it.
AUTHOR: William Tecumseh Sherman

QUOTE: Courage is not the absence of despair; it is, rather, the capacity to move ahead in spite of despair.

QUOTE: We must have courage to bet on our ideas, to take the calculated risk, and to act. Everyday living requires courage if life is to be effective and bring happiness.

QUOTE: People with courage and character always seem sinister to the rest.

QUOTE: Never be discouraged. If I were sunk in the lowest pits of Nova Scotia, with the Rocky Mountains piled on me, I would hang on, exercise faith, and keep up good courage, and I would come out on top.

QUOTE: Clear thinking requires courage rather than intelligence.
AUTHOR: Thomas Szasz

QUOTE: Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections.
AUTHOR: Saint Francis de Sales

QUOTE: The best protection any woman can have... is courage.
AUTHOR: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

QUOTE: We have a powerful potential in out youth, and we must have the courage to change old ideas and practices so that we may direct their power toward good ends.

QUOTE: The trials on the road to world harmony are no greater than the courage of those who accept the challenge.

QUOTE: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.

QUOTE: Living in dreams of yesterday, we find ourselves still dreaming of impossible future conquests.

QUOTE: Dreams are true while they last, and do we not live in dreams?

QUOTE: The world needs dreamers and the world needs doers. But above all, the world needs dreamers who do.

QUOTE: When you cease to dream you cease to live.

QUOTE: Like all dreamers, I mistook disenchantment for truth.

QUOTE: Ideologies separate us. Dreams and anguish bring us together.

QUOTE: I think we dream so we don't have to be apart so long. If we're in each other's dreams, we can play together all night.

QUOTE: I've always said that one night, I'm going to find myself in some field somewhere, I'm standing on grass, and it's raining, and I'm with the person I love, and I know I'm at the very point I've been dreaming of getting to.

QUOTE: I do not know whether I was then a man dreaming I was a butterfly, or whether I am now a butterfly dreaming I am a man.

QUOTE: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.
AUTHOR: Yoko Ono

QUOTE: No one should negotiate their dreams. Dreams must be free to fly high. No government, no legislature, has a right to limit your dreams. You should never agree to surrender your dreams.

QUOTE: Only in our dreams are we free. The rest of the time we need wages.

QUOTE: The dreamer can know no truth, not even about his dream, except by awaking out of it.

QUOTE: I stand for freedom of expression, doing what you believe in, and going after your dreams.

QUOTE: Those who have compared our life to a dream were right... we were sleeping wake, and waking sleep.

QUOTE: Dream manfully and nobly, and thy dreams shall be prophets.

QUOTE: Perhaps life is just that... a dream and a fear.

QUOTE: All the things one has forgotten scream for help in dreams.

QUOTE: God's gifts put man's best dreams to shame.

QUOTE: I am a dreamer. Seriously, I'm living on another planet.

QUOTE: Dreaming or awake, we perceive only events that have meaning to us.

QUOTE: All men of action are dreamers.
AUTHOR: James Huneker

QUOTE: Sometimes, the only realists are the dreamers.
AUTHOR: Paul Wellstone

QUOTE: I don't use drugs, my dreams are frightening enough.
AUTHOR: M. C. Escher

QUOTE: My dreams were all my own; I accounted for them to nobody; they were my refuge when annoyed - my dearest pleasure when free.
AUTHOR: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

QUOTE: Kings in this world should imitate God, their mercy should be above their works.
AUTHOR: William Penn

QUOTE: I wanted to be a teacher. I love children, so I wanted to deal with children. Then I wanted to be a veterinarian. But by the age of ten or eleven, when I opened my mouth and said, 'Oh, God, what's this?' I kind of knew teaching and being a veterinarian were gonna have to wait.
AUTHOR: Whitney Houston

QUOTE: It does not require great learning to be a Christian and be convinced of the truth of the Bible. It requires only an honest heart and a willingness to obey God.
AUTHOR: Albert Barnes

QUOTE: A man is truly free, even here in this embodied state, if he knows that God is the true agent and he by himself is powerless to do anything.
AUTHOR: Ramakrishna

QUOTE: Pray to God that your attachment to such transitory things as wealth, name, and creature comforts may become less and less every day.
AUTHOR: Ramakrishna

QUOTE: In life, you have people that love to party. That's me. People that love God. That's me. People that love sex. That's me. People that love people. That's me. And people that make mistakes.That's me also.
AUTHOR: R. Kelly

QUOTE: It is one of the ironies of the ministry that the very man who works in God's name is often hardest put to find time for God. The parents of Jesus lost Him at church, and they were not the last ones to lose Him there.
AUTHOR: Vance Havner

QUOTE: Man, as long as he lives, is immortal. One minute before his death he shall be immortal. But one minute later, God wins.
AUTHOR: Elie Wiesel

QUOTE: It is a curious phenomena that God has made the hearts of the poor, rich and those of the rich, poor.
AUTHOR: Vinoba Bhave

QUOTE: Whatever crushes individuality is despotism, by whatever name it may be called and whether it professes to be enforcing the will of God or the injunctions of men.
AUTHOR: John Stuart Mill

QUOTE: God is patient with us to become the God's children he wants us to be but you really can see him weeping.
AUTHOR: Desmond Tutu

QUOTE: I want to love all the children of God - Christian, Jew, Moslem, Hindu, Buddhist - everyone. I want to love gay Christians and straight Christians.
AUTHOR: Anne Rice

QUOTE: In the Bible, we first encounter God when he sides with a bunch of slaves against a powerful Pharaoh, an act of grace freely given.
AUTHOR: Desmond Tutu

QUOTE: I am God's vessel. But my greatest pain in life is that I will never be able to see myself perform live.
AUTHOR: Kanye West

QUOTE: My dear brothers, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry, for man's anger does not bring about the righteous life that God desires.

QUOTE: We're all of us guinea pigs in the laboratory of God. Humanity is just a work in progress.
AUTHOR: Tennessee Williams

QUOTE: When I speak of natural drummers I'm talking about guys that are playing with the talent God gave 'em.
AUTHOR: Gene Krupa

QUOTE: God's arrows of affliction are sharp and painful so He can get our attention. He won't let His beloved children get away with sin because He knows it robs us of blessings, opportunities, and even character refinement.
AUTHOR: Charles Stanley

QUOTE: I was baptized alongside my mother when I was 8 years old. Since then, I have tried to walk a Christian life. And now that I'm getting older, I realized that I'm walking even closer with my God.
AUTHOR: Andy Griffith

QUOTE: I don't have a religion. I believe in a God. I don't know what it looks like but it's MY god. My own interpretation of the supernatural.
AUTHOR: Jennifer Aniston

QUOTE: It is very lonely sometimes, trying to play God.
AUTHOR: Oliver Wendell Holmes

QUOTE: I don't really know why I care so much. I just have something inside me that tells me that there is a problem, and I have got to do something about it. I think that is what I would call the God in me.

QUOTE: What law, what reason can deny that gift so sweet, so natural that God has given a stream, a fish, a beast, a bird?

QUOTE: He must pull out his own eyes, and see no creature, before he can say, he sees no God; He must be no man, and quench his reasonable soul, before he can say to himself, there is no God.

QUOTE: A man filled with the love of God is not content with blessing his family alone, but ranges through the whole world, anxious to bless the whole human race.
AUTHOR: Joseph Smith, Jr.

QUOTE: Everyone should be respected as an individual, but no one idolized.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Let every man be respected as an individual and no man idolized.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: An individual who breaks a law that conscience tells him is unjust, and who willingly accepts the penalty of imprisonment in order to arouse the conscience of the community over its injustice, is in reality expressing the highest respect for the law.

QUOTE: Be peaceful, be courteous, obey the law, respect everyone; but if someone puts his hand on you, send him to the cemetery.

QUOTE: If once you forfeit the confidence of your fellow-citizens, you can never regain their respect and esteem.

QUOTE: I'm not concerned with your liking or disliking me... All I ask is that you respect me as a human being.

QUOTE: When people do not respect us we are sharply offended; yet in his private heart no man much respects himself.

QUOTE: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.

QUOTE: Men are so willing to respect anything that bores them.

QUOTE: Respect is what we owe; love, what we give.

QUOTE: One of the most sincere forms of respect is actually listening to what another has to say.

QUOTE: I think I'm a natural-born leader. I know how to bow down to authority if it's authority that I respect.

QUOTE: Respect your efforts, respect yourself. Self-respect leads to self-discipline. When you have both firmly under your belt, that's real power.

QUOTE: Go up close to your friend, but do not go over to him! We should also respect the enemy in our friend.

QUOTE: I never make the mistake of arguing with people for whose opinions I have no respect.

QUOTE: Nothing is more despicable than respect based on fear.

QUOTE: I have no right, by anything I do or say, to demean a human being in his own eyes. What matters is not what I think of him; it is what he thinks of himself. To undermine a man's self-respect is a sin.

QUOTE: If we are not free, no one will respect us.

QUOTE: The prospect of going home is very appealing.

QUOTE: A heart makes a good home for the friend.

QUOTE: Home, nowadays, is a place where part of the family waits till the rest of the family brings the car back.

QUOTE: I grew up in a household where everybody lived at the top of his lungs.

QUOTE: The home to everyone is to him his castle and fortress, as well for his defence against injury and violence, as for his repose.

QUOTE: I'm a real Suzy Homemaker.

QUOTE: The house has to please everyone, contrary to the work of art which does not. The work is a private matter for the artist. The house is not.

QUOTE: When I go home, its an easy way to be grounded. You learn to realize what truly matters.

QUOTE: I'm lucky because I have a job I love. I really miss being away from home, being in my own bed, seeing my animals and siblings, having my moms cookies. I have a couple cats. I got a kitten about a year ago and now Im going on the road so I wont see him for a while. I feel bad.
AUTHOR: Michelle Branch

QUOTE: Home is one's birthplace, ratified by memory.
AUTHOR: Henry Anatole Grunwald

QUOTE: Love begins by taking care of the closest ones - the ones at home.

QUOTE: Home is where you feel at home and are treated well.

QUOTE: At home I am a nice guy: but I don't want the world to know. Humble people, I've found, don't get very far.

QUOTE: When I am abroad, I always make it a rule never to criticize or attack the government of my own country. I make up for lost time when I come home.

QUOTE: Even in the presence of others he was completely alone.

QUOTE: As I get older I'm more and more comfortable being alone.

QUOTE: I have so many different personalities in me and I still feel lonely.

QUOTE: Every man is born as many men and dies as a single one.

QUOTE: Remember we're all in this alone.

QUOTE: Is he alone who has courage on his right hand and faith on his left hand?

QUOTE: The strongest man in the world is he who stands most alone.

QUOTE: It is very easy to love alone.

QUOTE: Being alone is very difficult.

QUOTE: If you make friends with yourself you will never be alone.

QUOTE: I would rather be a beggar and single than a queen and married.

QUOTE: Health is the greatest possession. Contentment is the greatest treasure. Confidence is the greatest friend. Non-being is the greatest joy.

QUOTE: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.

QUOTE: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.

QUOTE: Someone's sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.

QUOTE: In a gentle way, you can shake the world.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: Be faithful to that which exists within yourself.

QUOTE: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.

QUOTE: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.

QUOTE: It is always the simple that produces the marvelous.

QUOTE: I believe that one defines oneself by reinvention. To not be like your parents. To not be like your friends. To be yourself. To cut yourself out of stone.

QUOTE: You change your life by changing your heart.
AUTHOR: Max Lucado

QUOTE: The best way out is always through.

AUTHOR: Richard Bach

QUOTE: Don't let the fear of striking out hold you back.

QUOTE: Thought is the wind, knowledge the sail, and mankind the vessel.
AUTHOR: Augustus Hare

QUOTE: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.

QUOTE: Enthusiasm moves the world.

QUOTE: A place for everything, everything in its place.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

QUOTE: Every charitable act is a stepping stone toward heaven.
AUTHOR: Henry Ward Beecher

QUOTE: I would probably work with Drake as he is massively inspirational to me as a writer as well as an artist. If not him, then Susan Boyle!
AUTHOR: Conor Maynard

QUOTE: This CD became something of a personal journey for me. The tone of the whole CD is uplifting and inspirational. It's an upper. We have enough downers in the world.
AUTHOR: Roma Downey

QUOTE: We all obviously need others to look up to, and be inspirational to us. Ford did a great job as far as putting the presidency back where it belonged, getting the trust back after Nixon. And President Reagan has been one of the most influential presidents.

QUOTE: The leaders who we admire who have been able to bring great change in the past - Gandhi, Martin Luther King, Nelson Mandela - they're all inspirational religious leaders and smart tacticians. It would be nice to find the Muslim Gandhi, wouldn't it?
AUTHOR: Dennis C. Blair

QUOTE: I love inspirational R&B, like Mary J. Blige and Jennifer Hudson. I want to do that. That kind of music stays with you.
AUTHOR: Ashthon Jones

QUOTE: You always draw inspiration from your family or your parents if they've proven to be inspirational. My mother is someone who's always been inspirational to me.
AUTHOR: Dustin Clare

QUOTE: A wise and frugal Government, which shall restrain men from injuring one another, which shall leave them otherwise free to regulate their own pursuits of industry and improvement, and shall not take from the mouth of labor the bread it has earned. This is the sum of good government, and this is necessary to close the circlue of our felicities.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: Government is not reason; it is not eloquent; it is force. Like fire, it is a dangerous servant and a fearful master.
AUTHOR: George Washington

QUOTE: No man is good enough to govern another man without the other's consent.
AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln

QUOTE: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: Government, even in its best state, is but a necessary evil; in its worst state, an intolerable one.
AUTHOR: Thomas Paine

QUOTE: We have the best government that money can buy.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Every government degenerates when trusted to the rulers of the people alone. The people themselves are its only safe depositories.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: It is error alone which needs the support of government. Truth can stand by itself.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: Whenever the people are well-informed, they can be trusted with their own government.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: The best minds are not in government. If any were, business would steal them away.
AUTHOR: Ronald Reagan

QUOTE: The marvel of all history is the patience with which men and women submit to burdens unnecessarily laid upon them by their governments.
AUTHOR: George Washington

QUOTE: Government 'help' to business is just as disastrous as government persecution... the only way a government can be of service to national prosperity is by keeping its hands off.

QUOTE: Giving money and power to government is like giving whiskey and car keys to teenage boys.
AUTHOR: P. J. O'Rourke

QUOTE: Knowledge will forever govern ignorance; and a people who mean to be their own governors must arm themselves with the power which knowledge gives.

QUOTE: Laws too gentle are seldom obeyed; too severe, seldom executed.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

QUOTE: That government is best which governs least.
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: If 'pro' is the opposite of 'con' what is the opposite of 'progress'?

QUOTE: Ancient Rome declined because it had a Senate, now what's going to happen to us with both a House and a Senate?

QUOTE: Laws are like sausages, it is better not to see them being made.

QUOTE: The government solution to a problem is usually as bad as the problem.

QUOTE: It is to be regretted that the rich and powerful too often bend the acts of government to their own selfish purposes.
