QUOTE: The government, which was designed for the people, has got into the hands of the bosses and their employers, the special interests. An invisible empire has been set up above the forms of democracy.
AUTHOR: Woodrow Wilson

QUOTE: Man will never be free until the last king is strangled with the entrails of the last priest.
AUTHOR: Denis Diderot

QUOTE: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: I have learned silence from the talkative, toleration from the intolerant, and kindness from the unkind; yet, strange, I am ungrateful to those teachers.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: You have to grow from the inside out. None can teach you, none can make you spiritual. There is no other teacher but your own soul.
AUTHOR: Swami Vivekananda

QUOTE: If I am walking with two other men, each of them will serve as my teacher. I will pick out the good points of the one and imitate them, and the bad points of the other and correct them in myself.
AUTHOR: Confucius

QUOTE: Everybody who is incapable of learning has taken to teaching.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: I have come to believe that a great teacher is a great artist and that there are as few as there are any other great artists. Teaching might even be the greatest of the arts since the medium is the human mind and spirit.
AUTHOR: John Steinbeck

QUOTE: What a blind person needs is not a teacher but another self.
AUTHOR: Helen Keller

QUOTE: Those who know how to think need no teachers.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: One looks back with appreciation to the brilliant teachers, but with gratitude to those who touched our human feelings. The curriculum is so much necessary raw material, but warmth is the vital element for the growing plant and for the soul of the child.
AUTHOR: Carl Jung

QUOTE: If you think your teacher is tough, wait until you get a boss. He doesn't have tenure.
AUTHOR: Bill Gates

QUOTE: Every child should have a caring adult in their lives. And that's not always a biological parent or family member. It may be a friend or neighbor. Often times it is a teacher.
AUTHOR: Joe Manchin

QUOTE: The one exclusive sign of thorough knowledge is the power of teaching.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: You can get help from teachers, but you are going to have to learn a lot by yourself, sitting alone in a room.
AUTHOR: Dr. Seuss

QUOTE: Most of us end up with no more than five or six people who remember us. Teachers have thousands of people who remember them for the rest of their lives.
AUTHOR: Andy Rooney

QUOTE: There are two kinds of teachers: the kind that fill you with so much quail shot that you can't move, and the kind that just gives you a little prod behind and you jump to the skies.
AUTHOR: Robert Frost

QUOTE: The teacher is the one who gets the most out of the lessons, and the true teacher is the learner.
AUTHOR: Elbert Hubbard

QUOTE: I had a terrible education. I attended a school for emotionally disturbed teachers.
AUTHOR: Woody Allen

QUOTE: After all manner of professors have done their best for us, the place we are to get knowledge is in books. The true university of these days is a collection of books.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: A good teacher can inspire hope, ignite the imagination, and instill a love of learning.
AUTHOR: Brad Henry

QUOTE: In a completely rational society, the best of us would be teachers and the rest of us would have to settle for something else.
AUTHOR: Lee Iacocca

QUOTE: The dream begins with a teacher who believes in you, who tugs and pushes and leads you to the next plateau, sometimes poking you with a sharp stick called 'truth'.
AUTHOR: Dan Rather

QUOTE: We spend the first twelve months of our children's lives teaching them to walk and talk and the next twelve telling them to sit down and shut up.
AUTHOR: Phyllis Diller

QUOTE: The smarter the journalists are, the better off society is. For to a degree, people read the press to inform themselves - and the better the teacher, the better the student body.
AUTHOR: Warren Buffett

QUOTE: A teacher who is attempting to teach without inspiring the pupil with a desire to learn is hammering on cold iron.
AUTHOR: Horace Mann

QUOTE: I like a teacher who gives you something to take home to think about besides homework.
AUTHOR: Lily Tomlin

QUOTE: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.
AUTHOR: Theodore Roosevelt

QUOTE: Heights by great men reached and kept were not obtained by sudden flight but, while their companions slept, they were toiling upward in the night.
AUTHOR: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

QUOTE: Never was anything great achieved without danger.
AUTHOR: Niccolo Machiavelli

QUOTE: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: Most great people have attained their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.
AUTHOR: Napoleon Hill

QUOTE: A retentive memory may be a good thing, but the ability to forget is the true token of greatness.
AUTHOR: Elbert Hubbard

QUOTE: A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions.
AUTHOR: Marcus Aurelius

QUOTE: As a child of God, I am greater than anything that can happen to me.
AUTHOR: Abdul Kalam

QUOTE: The greater the obstacle, the more glory in overcoming it.
AUTHOR: Moliere

QUOTE: Great people talk about ideas, average people talk about things, and small people talk about wine.
AUTHOR: Fran Lebowitz

QUOTE: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
AUTHOR: Vincent Van Gogh

QUOTE: Do you wish to be great? Then begin by being. Do you desire to construct a vast and lofty fabric? Think first about the foundations of humility. The higher your structure is to be, the deeper must be its foundation.
AUTHOR: Saint Augustine

QUOTE: Greatness lies, not in being strong, but in the right using of strength; and strength is not used rightly when it serves only to carry a man above his fellows for his own solitary glory. He is the greatest whose strength carries up the most hearts by the attraction of his own.
AUTHOR: Henry Ward Beecher

QUOTE: Don't be humble... you're not that great.
AUTHOR: Golda Meir

QUOTE: Behind every great fortune lies a great crime.
AUTHOR: Honore de Balzac

QUOTE: The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness.
AUTHOR: Fyodor Dostoevsky

QUOTE: And the American people are the greatest people in the world. What makes America the greatest nation in the world is the heart of the American people: hardworking, innovative, risk-taking, God- loving, family-oriented American people.
AUTHOR: Mitt Romney

QUOTE: The greatest mistake we make is living in constant fear that we will make one.
AUTHOR: John C. Maxwell

QUOTE: Heaven and hell suppose two distinct species of men, the good and the bad. But the greatest part of mankind float betwixt vice and virtue.
AUTHOR: David Hume

QUOTE: Great talents are the most lovely and often the most dangerous fruits on the tree of humanity. They hang upon the most slender twigs that are easily snapped off.
AUTHOR: Carl Jung

QUOTE: Harmony makes small things grow, lack of it makes great things decay.
AUTHOR: Sallust

QUOTE: Believe deep down in your heart that you're destined to do great things.
AUTHOR: Joe Paterno

QUOTE: A mistake made by many people with great convictions is that they will let nothing stand in the way of their views, not even kindness.
AUTHOR: Bryant H. McGill

QUOTE: I think what motivates people is not great hate, but great love for other people.
AUTHOR: Huey Newton

QUOTE: Choosing to be positive and having a grateful attitude is going to determine how you're going to live your life.
AUTHOR: Joel Osteen

QUOTE: Weakness of attitude becomes weakness of character.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Nothing can stop the man with the right mental attitude from achieving his goal; nothing on earth can help the man with the wrong mental attitude.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: Your living is determined not so much by what life brings to you as by the attitude you bring to life; not so much by what happens to you as by the way your mind looks at what happens.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.
AUTHOR: Zig Ziglar

QUOTE: Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you, knowing that every step forward is a step toward achieving something bigger and better than your current situation.
AUTHOR: Brian Tracy

QUOTE: There is little difference in people, but that little difference makes a big difference. The little difference is attitude. The big difference is whether it is positive or negative.
AUTHOR: W. Clement Stone

QUOTE: Keep a good attitude and do the right thing even when it's hard. When you do that you are passing the test. And God promises you your marked moments are on their way.
AUTHOR: Joel Osteen

QUOTE: A positive attitude causes a chain reaction of positive thoughts, events and outcomes. It is a catalyst and it sparks extraordinary results.
AUTHOR: Wade Boggs

QUOTE: Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of human freedoms - to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one's own way.
AUTHOR: Viktor E. Frankl

QUOTE: Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people whom we personally dislike.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: Whenever you're in conflict with someone, there is one factor that can make the difference between damaging your relationship and deepening it. That factor is attitude.
AUTHOR: William James

QUOTE: The greatest day in your life and mine is when we take total responsibility for our attitudes. That's the day we truly grow up.
AUTHOR: John C. Maxwell

QUOTE: I hope the millions of people I've touched have the optimism and desire to share their goals and hard work and persevere with a positive attitude.
AUTHOR: Michael Jordan

QUOTE: It is not the body's posture, but the heart's attitude that counts when we pray.
AUTHOR: Billy Graham

QUOTE: You cannot control what happens to you, but you can control your attitude toward what happens to you, and in that, you will be mastering change rather than allowing it to master you.
AUTHOR: Brian Tracy

QUOTE: People may hear your words, but they feel your attitude.
AUTHOR: John C. Maxwell

QUOTE: Watch your manner of speech if you wish to develop a peaceful state of mind. Start each day by affirming peaceful, contented and happy attitudes and your days will tend to be pleasant and successful.
AUTHOR: Norman Vincent Peale

QUOTE: You cannot tailor-make the situations in life but you can tailor-make the attitudes to fit those situations.
AUTHOR: Zig Ziglar

QUOTE: We cannot change our past. We can not change the fact that people act in a certain way. We can not change the inevitable. The only thing we can do is play on the one string we have, and that is our attitude.
AUTHOR: Charles R. Swindoll

QUOTE: Ability is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.
AUTHOR: Raymond Chandler

QUOTE: Our attitude towards others determines their attitude towards us.
AUTHOR: Earl Nightingale

QUOTE: Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.
AUTHOR: Elbert Hubbard

QUOTE: I am a kind of paranoid in reverse. I suspect people of plotting to make me happy.
AUTHOR: J. D. Salinger

QUOTE: You must try to generate happiness within yourself. If you aren't happy in one place, chances are you won't be happy anyplace.
AUTHOR: Ernie Banks

QUOTE: Always leave something to wish for; otherwise you will be miserable from your very happiness.
AUTHOR: Baltasar Gracian

QUOTE: When what we are is what we want to be, that's happiness.
AUTHOR: Malcolm Forbes

QUOTE: It is not God's will merely that we should be happy, but that we should make ourselves happy.
AUTHOR: Immanuel Kant

QUOTE: The secret of happiness is to admire without desiring.
AUTHOR: Carl Sandburg

QUOTE: Happy he who learns to bear what he cannot change.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Schiller

QUOTE: Happiness exists on earth, and it is won through prudent exercise of reason, knowledge of the harmony of the universe, and constant practice of generosity.
AUTHOR: Jose Marti

QUOTE: Happiness: an agreeable sensation arising from contemplating the misery of another.
AUTHOR: Ambrose Bierce

QUOTE: Happiness is like those palaces in fairy tales whose gates are guarded by dragons: we must fight in order to conquer it.
AUTHOR: Alexandre Dumas

QUOTE: Happiness is having a scratch for every itch.
AUTHOR: Ogden Nash

QUOTE: Happiness does not lie in happiness, but in the achievement of it.
AUTHOR: Fyodor Dostoevsky

QUOTE: Nothing prevents happiness like the memory of happiness.
AUTHOR: Andre Gide

QUOTE: True happiness consists not in the multitude of friends, but in the worth and choice.
AUTHOR: Ben Jonson

QUOTE: Lovers who love truly do not write down their happiness.
AUTHOR: Anatole France

QUOTE: Money can't buy you happiness, but it can buy you a yacht big enough to pull up right alongside it.
AUTHOR: David Lee Roth

QUOTE: Happiness grows at our own firesides, and is not to be picked in strangers' gardens.
AUTHOR: Douglas William Jerrold

QUOTE: Happiness comes only when we push our brains and hearts to the farthest reaches of which we are capable.
AUTHOR: Leo Rosten

QUOTE: It is the chiefest point of happiness that a man is willing to be what he is.
AUTHOR: Desiderius Erasmus

QUOTE: Happiness is itself a kind of gratitude.
AUTHOR: Joseph Wood Krutch

QUOTE: Happiness is a direction, not a place.
AUTHOR: Sydney J. Harris

QUOTE: Happiness is brief. It will not stay. God batters at its sails.
AUTHOR: Euripides

QUOTE: The moments of happiness we enjoy take us by surprise. It is not that we seize them, but that they seize us.
AUTHOR: Ashley Montagu

QUOTE: If you wait for the perfect moment when all is safe and assured, it may never arrive. Mountains will not be climbed, races won, or lasting happiness achieved.
AUTHOR: Maurice Chevalier

QUOTE: To describe happiness is to diminish it.
AUTHOR: Stendhal

QUOTE: 'Beauty is truth, truth beauty,' - that is all ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.
AUTHOR: John Keats

QUOTE: Peace if possible, truth at all costs.
AUTHOR: Martin Luther

QUOTE: Once you eliminate the impossible, whatever remains, no matter how improbable, must be the truth.
AUTHOR: Arthur Conan Doyle

QUOTE: The water in a vessel is sparkling; the water in the sea is dark. The small truth has words which are clear; the great truth has great silence.
AUTHOR: Rabindranath Tagore

QUOTE: Only enemies speak the truth; friends and lovers lie endlessly, caught in the web of duty.
AUTHOR: Stephen King

QUOTE: I maintain that Truth is a pathless land, and you cannot approach it by any path whatsoever, by any religion, by any sect.
AUTHOR: Jiddu Krishnamurti

QUOTE: Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for the truth.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Disraeli

QUOTE: Facts are many, but the truth is one.
AUTHOR: Rabindranath Tagore

QUOTE: Hard times arouse an instinctive desire for authenticity.
AUTHOR: Coco Chanel

QUOTE: Truth is like the sun. You can shut it out for a time, but it ain't goin' away.
AUTHOR: Elvis Presley

QUOTE: My mother taught me that when you stand in the truth and someone tells a lie about you, don't fight it.
AUTHOR: Whitney Houston

QUOTE: A dog barks when his master is attacked. I would be a coward if I saw that God's truth is attacked and yet would remain silent.
AUTHOR: John Calvin

QUOTE: All the truth in the world adds up to one big lie.
AUTHOR: Bob Dylan

QUOTE: A truth that's told with bad intent beats all the lies you can invent.
AUTHOR: William Blake

QUOTE: The earth is supported by the power of truth; it is the power of truth that makes the sun shine and the winds blow; indeed all things rest upon truth.
AUTHOR: Chanakya

QUOTE: It is always the best policy to speak the truth, unless, of course, you are an exceptionally good liar.
AUTHOR: Jerome K. Jerome

QUOTE: I tore myself away from the safe comfort of certainties through my love for truth - and truth rewarded me.
AUTHOR: Simone de Beauvoir

QUOTE: Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance.
AUTHOR: W. Clement Stone

QUOTE: Every truth has two sides; it is as well to look at both, before we commit ourselves to either.
AUTHOR: Aesop

QUOTE: People will generally accept facts as truth only if the facts agree with what they already believe.
AUTHOR: Andy Rooney

QUOTE: The truth is more important than the facts.
AUTHOR: Frank Lloyd Wright

QUOTE: There is no greatness where there is no simplicity, goodness and truth.
AUTHOR: Leo Tolstoy

QUOTE: There are some people so addicted to exaggeration that they can't tell the truth without lying.

QUOTE: Adversity is the first path to truth.
AUTHOR: Lord Byron

QUOTE: I say that justice is truth in action.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Disraeli

QUOTE: Beauty is everything.
AUTHOR: Jorja Fox

QUOTE: When the soul looks out of its body, it should see only beauty in its path. These are the sights we must hold in mind, in order to move to a higher place.
AUTHOR: Yusef Lateef

QUOTE: I feel fortunate that I'm not a beauty. I'm not a classic beauty. I feel it is harder for girls who are like that. There are fewer parts.
AUTHOR: Olivia Colman

QUOTE: My mum is my beauty icon, because she represents what I think beauty is.
AUTHOR: Bar Refaeli

QUOTE: My everyday job is about superficial beauty, but when I'm not working I prefer to work on my inner beauty - I read a lot, I try to learn.
AUTHOR: Bar Refaeli

QUOTE: So as I look at transitioning to the communication platforms of the future, I see that the beauty of Internet protocols is you get the separation of the layers between service and technology.
AUTHOR: Michael K. Powell

QUOTE: The beauty comes with the balance. Everyone should find his own balance in his personal as well as his professional life. Once you do so, you will feel and look beautiful.
AUTHOR: Karolina Kurkova

QUOTE: I'm from Canada, and New Zealand feels like you took all the best bits of Canada and squished them onto a tiny island like Hawaii. I was absolutely blown away by the beauty of the South Island.
AUTHOR: Evangeline Lilly

QUOTE: My sisters and I were fortunate to travel through Asia and Europe at very young ages. We confronted extraordinary beauty in Athens and unspeakable poverty in India.
AUTHOR: Mary Chapin Carpenter

QUOTE: An image of the Earth, its landscapes, directly affects people. The beauty of the Earth creates enormous emotion, and through that emotion, you can transmit knowledge and raise consciousness.
AUTHOR: Yann Arthus-Bertrand

QUOTE: A painstaking course in qualitative and quantitative analysis by John Wing gave me an appreciation of the need for, and beauty of, accurate measurement.
AUTHOR: Paul D. Boyer

QUOTE: I think the beauty of the writing of 'Game of Thrones' is not that the characters are fearless; it's how they overcome their fear, you know?
AUTHOR: Natalie Dormer

QUOTE: Visual surprise is natural in the Caribbean; it comes with the landscape, and faced with its beauty, the sigh of History dissolves.

QUOTE: Mathematics are the result of mysterious powers which no one understands, and which the unconscious recognition of beauty must play an important part. Out of an infinity of designs a mathematician chooses one pattern for beauty's sake and pulls it down to earth.

QUOTE: People come to see beauty, and I dance to give it to them.
AUTHOR: Judith Jamison

QUOTE: Stories aren't the beauty of what did happen. They're the beauty of what could happen.
AUTHOR: Brad Meltzer

QUOTE: Beauty, of course, is the most important requirement and the paramount asset of the applicant.

QUOTE: The beauty of 'The Walking Dead' and the beauty of being on a television show for a while, is that, it's your backstory, it's part of what you are, it's what you carry with you every day.

QUOTE: Acting is still, of course, what I love to do most. The beauty of it is that by changing characters, it never gets boring.
AUTHOR: Christopher Lambert

QUOTE: The sport of horse racing which, at its best, showcases the majestic beauty of this animal and the athleticism of jockeys, has reached an alarming level of corruption and exploitation.
AUTHOR: Tom Udall

QUOTE: I like to have Chinese furniture in my home as a constant and painful reminder of how much has been destroyed in China. The contrast between the beauty of the past and the ugliness of the modern is nowhere sharper than in China.
AUTHOR: Jung Chang

QUOTE: Beauty magazines make my girlfriend feel ugly.
AUTHOR: James De La Vega

QUOTE: I will admit to hoarding beauty products. I'm a beauty lady.
AUTHOR: Naya Rivera

QUOTE: You can muck around with different guitars for certain bits, but you have to have your own sound. That's your benchmark, that's your sound. I also play a Black Beauty. It sounds amazing.
AUTHOR: Dan Hawkins

QUOTE: The arts, quite simply, nourish the soul. They sustain, comfort, inspire. There is nothing like that exquisite moment when you first discover the beauty of connecting with others in celebration of larger ideals and shared wisdom.
AUTHOR: Gordon Gee

QUOTE: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
AUTHOR: Soren Kierkegaard

QUOTE: The only source of knowledge is experience.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Experience: that most brutal of teachers. But you learn, my God do you learn.
AUTHOR: C. S. Lewis

QUOTE: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: A man who carries a cat by the tail learns something he can learn in no other way.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.
AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln

QUOTE: We are not human beings having a spiritual experience. We are spiritual beings having a human experience.

QUOTE: Experience is one thing you can't get for nothing.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built.

QUOTE: A mind that is stretched by a new experience can never go back to its old dimensions.

QUOTE: Man learns through experience, and the spiritual path is full of different kinds of experiences. He will encounter many difficulties and obstacles, and they are the very experiences he needs to encourage and complete the cleansing process.
AUTHOR: Sai Baba

QUOTE: The years teach much which the days never know.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: Do you know the difference between education and experience? Education is when you read the fine print; experience is what you get when you don't.
AUTHOR: Pete Seeger

QUOTE: I made decisions that I regret, and I took them as learning experiences... I'm human, not perfect, like anybody else.
AUTHOR: Queen Latifah

QUOTE: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude.
AUTHOR: Ralph Marston

QUOTE: Life is the art of drawing without an eraser.
AUTHOR: John W. Gardner

QUOTE: Human beings, who are almost unique in having the ability to learn from the experience of others, are also remarkable for their apparent disinclination to do so.
AUTHOR: Douglas Adams

QUOTE: You cannot create experience. You must undergo it.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: A woman's life can really be a succession of lives, each revolving around some emotionally compelling situation or challenge, and each marked off by some intense experience.
AUTHOR: Wallis Simpson

QUOTE: Everything has been said before, but since nobody listens we have to keep going back and beginning all over again.
AUTHOR: Andre Gide

QUOTE: When you have really exhausted an experience you always reverence and love it.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: Experience is the teacher of all things.
AUTHOR: Julius Caesar

QUOTE: Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely.
AUTHOR: Auguste Rodin

QUOTE: Nothing ever becomes real till it is experienced.
AUTHOR: John Keats

QUOTE: Experience teaches only the teachable.
AUTHOR: Aldous Huxley

QUOTE: A joke is a very serious thing.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: Humor is mankind's greatest blessing.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: If I had no sense of humor, I would long ago have committed suicide.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: Everything human is pathetic. The secret source of humor itself is not joy but sorrow. There is no humor in heaven.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Common sense and a sense of humor are the same thing, moving at different speeds. A sense of humor is just common sense, dancing.
AUTHOR: William James

QUOTE: The secret source of humor is not joy but sorrow; there is no humor in Heaven.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: A person without a sense of humor is like a wagon without springs. It's jolted by every pebble on the road.
AUTHOR: Henry Ward Beecher

QUOTE: You can turn painful situations around through laughter. If you can find humor in anything, even poverty, you can survive it.
AUTHOR: Bill Cosby

QUOTE: A sense of humor... is needed armor. Joy in one's heart and some laughter on one's lips is a sign that the person down deep has a pretty good grasp of life.
AUTHOR: Hugh Sidey

QUOTE: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not; a sense of humor to console him for what he is.
AUTHOR: Francis Bacon

QUOTE: Everywhere is within walking distance if you have the time.
AUTHOR: Steven Wright

QUOTE: The secret to humor is surprise.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: There is hope for the future because God has a sense of humor and we are funny to God.
AUTHOR: Bill Cosby

QUOTE: Alimony is like buying hay for a dead horse.
AUTHOR: Groucho Marx

QUOTE: When humor goes, there goes civilization.
AUTHOR: Erma Bombeck

QUOTE: A well-developed sense of humor is the pole that adds balance to your steps as you walk the tightrope of life.
AUTHOR: William Arthur Ward

QUOTE: Humor is reason gone mad.
AUTHOR: Groucho Marx

QUOTE: My computer beat me at checkers, but I sure beat it at kickboxing.
AUTHOR: Emo Philips

QUOTE: A sense of humor is a major defense against minor troubles.
AUTHOR: Mignon McLaughlin

QUOTE: Like a welcome summer rain, humor may suddenly cleanse and cool the earth, the air and you.
AUTHOR: Langston Hughes

QUOTE: Humor is perhaps a sense of intellectual perspective: an awareness that some things are really important, others not; and that the two kinds are most oddly jumbled in everyday affairs.
AUTHOR: Christopher Morley

QUOTE: Analyzing humor is like dissecting a frog. Few people are interested and the frog dies of it.
AUTHOR: E. B. White

QUOTE: Comedy is simply a funny way of being serious.
AUTHOR: Peter Ustinov

QUOTE: A taste for irony has kept more hearts from breaking than a sense of humor, for it takes irony to appreciate the joke which is on oneself.
AUTHOR: Jessamyn West

QUOTE: The art of newspaper paragraphing is to stroke a platitude until it purrs like an epigram.
AUTHOR: Don Marquis

QUOTE: Dance is the only art of which we ourselves are the stuff of which it is made.
AUTHOR: Ted Shawn

QUOTE: Nothing retains less of desire in art, in science, than this will to industry, booty, possession.
AUTHOR: Andre Breton

QUOTE: I don't like watching people work if they're making art.
AUTHOR: David Duchovny

QUOTE: The basis of art is truth, both in matter and in mode.
AUTHOR: Flannery O'Connor

QUOTE: Art is one thing that can go on mattering once it has stopped hurting.
AUTHOR: Elizabeth Bowen

QUOTE: Of course the illusion of art is to make one believe that great literature is very close to life, but exactly the opposite is true. Life is amorphous, literature is formal.
AUTHOR: Francoise Sagan

QUOTE: I'm very manipulative towards directors. My theory is that everyone on the set is directing the film, we're all receiving art messages from the universe on how we should do the film.
AUTHOR: Jeff Bridges

QUOTE: I'm very much into the costuming of any character that I portray and it's one of the great things about making movies is it's a collaborative art form so you get all these artists who are looking specifically about for this instance your character's costume and what that might tell about your character.
AUTHOR: Jeff Bridges

QUOTE: Writing stopped being fun when I discovered the difference between good writing and bad and, even more terrifying, the difference between it and true art. And after that, the whip came down.
AUTHOR: Truman Capote

QUOTE: It's important to debunk the myths of Africa being this benighted continent civilized only when white people arrived. In fact, Africans had been creators of culture for thousands of years before. These were very intelligent, subtle and sophisticated people, with organized societies and great art.
AUTHOR: Henry Louis Gates

QUOTE: It has taken me years of struggle, hard work and research to learn to make one simple gesture, and I know enough about the art of writing to realize that it would take as many years of concentrated effort to write one simple, beautiful sentence.
AUTHOR: Isadora Duncan

QUOTE: Intolerance respecting other people's religion is toleration itself in comparison with intolerance respecting other people's art.
AUTHOR: Wallace Stevens

QUOTE: I am an anarchist in politics and an impressionist in art as well as a symbolist in literature. Not that I understand what these terms mean, but I take them to be all merely synonyms of pessimist.
AUTHOR: Henry Adams

QUOTE: All good criticism should be judged the way art is. You shouldn't read it the way you read history or science.
AUTHOR: Leslie Fiedler

QUOTE: Only in men's imagination does every truth find an effective and undeniable existence. Imagination, not invention, is the supreme master of art as of life.
AUTHOR: Joseph Conrad

QUOTE: I think it's pretentious to create art just for the sake of stroking the artists ego.
AUTHOR: Lou Reed

QUOTE: All art is exorcism. I paint dreams and visions too; the dreams and visions of my time. Painting is the effort to produce order; order in yourself. There is much chaos in me, much chaos in our time.
AUTHOR: Otto Dix

QUOTE: The art of the parenthesis is one of the greatest secrets of eloquence in Society.
AUTHOR: Nicolas Chamfort

QUOTE: Art is the human disposition of sensible or intelligible matter for an esthetic end.
AUTHOR: Milan Kundera

QUOTE: The temple of art is built in words.
AUTHOR: J. G. Holland

QUOTE: Poetry is emotion put into measure. The emotion must come by nature, but the measure can be acquired by art.
AUTHOR: Thomas Hardy

QUOTE: Film in the 20th century, it's the American art form, like jazz.
AUTHOR: Martin Scorsese

QUOTE: There are so many opportunities in life, that the loss of two or three capabilities is not necessarily debilitating. A handicap can give you the opportunity to focus more on art, writing, or music.
AUTHOR: Jim Davis

QUOTE: The art of living consists in knowing which impulses to obey and which must be made to obey.
AUTHOR: Sydney J. Harris

QUOTE: If some great catastrophe is not announced every morning, we feel a certain void. Nothing in the paper today, we sigh.
AUTHOR: Lord Acton

QUOTE: Morning comes whether you set the alarm or not.
AUTHOR: Ursula K. Le Guin

QUOTE: Never face facts; if you do you'll never get up in the morning.

QUOTE: Wherever you go, no matter what the weather, always bring your own sunshine.

QUOTE: That which is not good for the bee-hive cannot be good for the bees.

QUOTE: Well, when you look at a lot of science fiction novels they're asking questions about power. There are questions about what it means to have power and what are the long-term consequences of power.

QUOTE: In the sense that you're not at the centre of power, like a president or prime minister of a major power, everyone is marginalised; my position doesn't isn't unique in that respect. I think there are different sorts of relevance in different contexts.

QUOTE: It is from weakness that people reach for dictators and concentrated government power. Only the strong can be free. And only the productive can be strong.

QUOTE: The real and lasting victories are those of peace, and not of war.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: We make war that we may live in peace.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: I dream of an Africa which is in peace with itself.
AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela

QUOTE: All truly historical peoples have an idea they must realize, and when they have sufficiently exploited it at home, they export it, in a certain way, by war; they make it tour the world.
AUTHOR: Victor Cousin

QUOTE: A majority of this country opposes this war, a majority of this country never voted for this administration.
AUTHOR: Michael Moore

QUOTE: No country in history ever sent mothers of toddlers off to fight enemy soldiers until the United States did this in the Iraq war.
AUTHOR: Phyllis Schlafly

QUOTE: The State thrives on war - unless, of course, it is defeated and crushed - expands on it, glories in it.
AUTHOR: Murray Rothbard

QUOTE: Yes, peace can and must be won, to save the world from the terrible destruction of World War III.

QUOTE: It's never acceptable to target civilians. It violates the Geneva Accords, it violates the international law of war and it violates all principles of morality.
AUTHOR: Alan Dershowitz

QUOTE: Killing is the payoff of war.

QUOTE: My point was that the war was intrinsically wrong, and as a result of our participation we haven't improved Australia's security but created a greater danger at home and abroad.
AUTHOR: Bob Hawke

QUOTE: Bush's war in Iraq has done untold damage to the United States. It has impaired our military power and undermined the morale of our armed forces. Our troops were trained to project overwhelming power. They were not trained for occupation duties.
AUTHOR: George Soros

QUOTE: After the atomic bombs were dropped, the war ended and we went into Tokyo Bay with the rest of the fleet, the Missouri and the rest of them, while they signed the terms of surrender that ended the war.
AUTHOR: Barney Ross

QUOTE: For the sake of the troops, for the love of the troops, we must not add yet another casualty to this war. We must not let truth be a casualty of this war.
AUTHOR: Barbara Boxer

QUOTE: Detainee policy in this war is hard, it's complicated, but we must get it right. We would be better off as a nation if we could close Gitmo safely and start a new prison that he could use that the world would see as a better way to doing business.
AUTHOR: Lindsey Graham

QUOTE: This war is like an actress who is getting old. It is less and less photogenic and more and more dangerous.
AUTHOR: Robert Capa

QUOTE: One side-effect of the so-called war on terror has been a crisis of liberalism. This is not only a question of alarmingly illiberal legislation, but a more general problem of how the liberal state deals with its anti-liberal enemies.
AUTHOR: Terry Eagleton

QUOTE: In a war, you must hate somebody or love somebody; you must have a position or you cannot stand what goes on.
AUTHOR: Robert Capa

QUOTE: There is such a thing as legitimate warfare: war has its laws; there are things which may fairly be done, and things which may not be done.
AUTHOR: John Henry Newman

QUOTE: If it's just screaming - and I know this sounds so ridiculous - that gets old. But sometimes when there's literal chaos, it's like being in a war zone, and that's kind of exciting. You're just running through the crowd of people chasing after you and no one knows what's going on.
AUTHOR: Robert Pattinson

QUOTE: I think the International Criminal Court could be a threat to American security interests, because the prosecutor of the court has enormous discretion in going after war crimes. And the way the Statute of Rome is written, responsibility for war crimes can be taken all the way up the chain of command.
AUTHOR: John Bolton

QUOTE: Money is the sinews of love, as of war.
AUTHOR: George Farquhar

QUOTE: We did an album one time called White Mansions, about the civil war, but it was written by a guy from England. His looking at it from over there and it not being a part of his history made it so he could be objective.
AUTHOR: Waylon Jennings

QUOTE: The road ahead is not easy. Iraq is currently the center of the war on terror.
AUTHOR: Doc Hastings

QUOTE: Every child's taste is different. Don't worry if they're not reading 'War and Peace' at age 12. First, build a good foundation and a positive attitude about reading by letting them pick the stories they enjoy. Make friends with a bookseller or librarian. They are a wealth of information on finding books that kids enjoy.
AUTHOR: Rick Riordan

QUOTE: The Dell Theory of Conflict Prevention argues that no two countries that are both part of the same global supply chain will ever fight a war as long as they are each part of that supply chain.
AUTHOR: Thomas Friedman

QUOTE: We know we must win the war on terror to protect innocent people and the freedoms that define our way of life.
AUTHOR: Doc Hastings

QUOTE: I frankly don't think it's going to be a successful war on terrorism until law enforcement agencies like the FBI are willing to share with other law enforcement agencies. If they can't share information, there's no way this war can be won.
AUTHOR: Patty Hearst

QUOTE: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
AUTHOR: Anais Nin

QUOTE: Have courage for the great sorrows of life and patience for the small ones; and when you have laboriously accomplished your daily task, go to sleep in peace.
AUTHOR: Victor Hugo

QUOTE: Failure is unimportant. It takes courage to make a fool of yourself.
AUTHOR: Charlie Chaplin

QUOTE: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.

QUOTE: The only service a friend can really render is to keep up your courage by holding up to you a mirror in which you can see a noble image of yourself.

QUOTE: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.

QUOTE: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.

QUOTE: Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are often stiffened.

QUOTE: Those who lack the courage will always find a philosophy to justify it.

QUOTE: Courage is a kind of salvation.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: Men make history and not the other way around. In periods where there is no leadership, society stands still. Progress occurs when courageous, skillful leaders seize the opportunity to change things for the better.

QUOTE: Be courageous. I have seen many depressions in business. Always America has emerged from these stronger and more prosperous. Be brave as your fathers before you. Have faith! Go forward!

QUOTE: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
AUTHOR: Andre Gide

QUOTE: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?

QUOTE: America was not built on fear. America was built on courage, on imagination and an unbeatable determination to do the job at hand.

QUOTE: Creativity requires the courage to let go of certainties.
AUTHOR: Erich Fromm

QUOTE: Courage is fire, and bullying is smoke.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Disraeli

QUOTE: It requires more courage to suffer than to die.
AUTHOR: Napoleon Bonaparte

QUOTE: God, give us grace to accept with serenity the things that cannot be changed, courage to change the things which should be changed and the wisdom to distinguish the one from the other.
AUTHOR: Reinhold Niebuhr

QUOTE: Any intelligent fool can make things bigger and more complex... It takes a touch of genius - and a lot of courage to move in the opposite direction.

QUOTE: To have courage for whatever comes in life - everything lies in that.
AUTHOR: Saint Teresa of Avila

QUOTE: The secret to happiness is freedom... And the secret to freedom is courage.

QUOTE: The opposite for courage is not cowardice, it is conformity. Even a dead fish can go with the flow.

QUOTE: Real courage is when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what.

QUOTE: Courage is the greatest of all virtues, because if you haven't courage, you may not have an opportunity to use any of the others.

QUOTE: It is sad not to love, but it is much sadder not to be able to love.
AUTHOR: Miguel de Unamuno

QUOTE: If you want to be loved, be lovable.
AUTHOR: Ovid

QUOTE: Before I met my husband, I'd never fallen in love. I'd stepped in it a few times.

QUOTE: Love is the joy of the good, the wonder of the wise, the amazement of the Gods.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: Only do what your heart tells you.
AUTHOR: Princess Diana

QUOTE: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.
AUTHOR: Voltaire

QUOTE: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.
AUTHOR: Paulo Coelho

QUOTE: Love is a gross exaggeration of the difference between one person and everybody else.

QUOTE: What love we've given, we'll have forever. What love we fail to give, will be lost for all eternity.

QUOTE: It's useless to hold a person to anything he says while he's in love, drunk, or running for office.

QUOTE: It is difficult to know at what moment love begins; it is less difficult to know that it has begun.
AUTHOR: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

QUOTE: The love we give away is the only love we keep.
AUTHOR: Elbert Hubbard

QUOTE: I love that feeling of being in love, the effect of having butterflies when you wake up in the morning. That is special.

QUOTE: Love is being stupid together.
AUTHOR: Paul Valery

QUOTE: When love is not madness, it is not love.
AUTHOR: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

QUOTE: A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another.

QUOTE: Love is when you meet someone who tells you something new about yourself.

QUOTE: The only abnormality is the incapacity to love.

QUOTE: In love the paradox occurs that two beings become one and yet remain two.

QUOTE: Blessed is the influence of one true, loving human soul on another.

QUOTE: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence.

QUOTE: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.
AUTHOR: Victor Hugo

QUOTE: Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit.
AUTHOR: Peter Ustinov

QUOTE: If you tell people where to go, but not how to get there, you'll be amazed at the results.

QUOTE: It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.

QUOTE: If you set goals and go after them with all the determination you can muster, your gifts will take you places that will amaze you.

QUOTE: It's amazing the clarity that comes with psychotic jealousy.

QUOTE: The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.

QUOTE: If there was an observer on Mars, they would probably be amazed that we have survived this long.

QUOTE: All men are children, and of one family. The same tale sends them all to bed, and wakes them in the morning.

QUOTE: So long as the memory of certain beloved friends lives in my heart, I shall say that life is good.

QUOTE: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.

QUOTE: Be true to your work, your word, and your friend.

QUOTE: The friend in my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity.

QUOTE: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.

QUOTE: The truth is the best picture, the best propaganda.

QUOTE: When Fortune smiles, I smile to think how quickly she will frown.

QUOTE: My culture-deprived, aspirational mother dragged me once a month from our northern suburb - where the word art never came up - to the Art Institute of Chicago. I hated it.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: I'm noticing a new approach to art making in recent museum and gallery shows. It flickered into focus at the New Museum's 'Younger Than Jesus' last year and ran through the Whitney Biennial, and I'm seeing it blossom and bear fruit at 'Greater New York,' MoMA P.S. 1's twice-a-decade extravaganza of emerging local talent.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Outside museums, in noisy public squares, people look at people. Inside museums, we leave that realm and enter what might be called the group-mind, getting quiet to look at art.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: It took the Metropolitan Museum of Art nearly 50 years to wake up to Pablo Picasso. It didn't own one of his paintings until 1946, when Gertrude Stein bequeathed that indomitable quasi-Cubistic picture of herself - a portrait of the writer as a sumo Buddha - to the Met, principally because she disliked the Museum of Modern Art.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Appropriation is the idea that ate the art world. Go to any Chelsea gallery or international biennial and you'll find it. It's there in paintings of photographs, photographs of advertising, sculpture with ready-made objects, videos using already-existing film.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: After its hothouse incubation in the seventies, appropriation breathed important new life into art. This life flowered spectacularly over the decades - even if it's now close to aesthetic kudzu.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: The New York art world readily proves people wrong. Just when folks say that things stink and flibbertigibbet critics wish the worst on us all because we're not pure enough, good omens appear.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Artistic qualities that once seemed undeniable don't seem so now. Sometimes these fluctuations are only fickleness of taste, momentary glitches in an artist's work, or an artist getting ahead of his audience (it took me ten years to catch up to Albert Oehlen). Other times, however, these problems mean there's something wrong with the art.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Can space break? I mean the space of art galleries. Over the past 100 years, art galleries have gone from looking like Beaux Arts salons to simple storefronts to industrial lofts to the gleaming giant white cubes of Chelsea with their shiny concrete floors.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: It's great that New York has large spaces for art. But the enormous immaculate box has become a dated, even oppressive place. Many of these spaces were designed for sprawling installations, large paintings, and the Relational Aesthetics work of the past fifteen years.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: The giant white cube is now impeding rather than enhancing the rhythms of art. It preprograms a viewer's journey, shifts the emphasis from process to product, and lacks individuality and openness. It's not that art should be seen only in rutty bombed-out environments, but it should seem alive.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: It's art that pushes against psychological and social expectations, that tries to transform decay into something generative, that is replicative in a baroque way, that isn't about progress, and wants to - as Walt Whitman put it - 'contain multitudes.'
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Much good art got made while money ruled; I like a lot of it, and hardship and poverty aren't virtues. The good news is that, since almost no one will be selling art, artists - especially emerging ones - won't have to think about turning out a consistent style or creating a brand. They'll be able to experiment as much as they want.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: When money and hype recede from the art world, one thing I won't miss will be what curator Francesco Bonami calls the 'Eventocracy.' All this flashy 'art-fair art' and those highly produced space-eating spectacles and installations wow you for a minute until you move on to the next adrenaline event.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: A saboteur in the house of art and a comedienne in the house of art theory, Lawler has spent three decades documenting the secret life of art. AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Works of art often last forever, or nearly so. But exhibitions themselves, especially gallery exhibitions, are like flowers; they bloom and then they die, then exist only as memories, or pressed in magazines and books.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: If only we could persuade galleries to observe a fallow period in which, for two months every other year, new and old works of art could be sold in back rooms and all main galleries would be devoted to revisiting shows gone by.

QUOTE: 'Untitled' is a time machine that can transport you to 1992, an edgy moment when the art world was crumbling, money was scarce, and artists like Tiravanija were in the nascent stages of combining Happenings, performance art, John Cage, Joseph Beuys, and the do-it-yourself ethos of punk. Meanwhile, a new art world was coming into being.

I'm a 'Deadwood' fan. It makes me optimistic for the future of storytelling on TV that producers are willing to take that kind of jump.

QUOTE: I think movies glamorize violence, in the sense that they make it in a way that it's either cool or funny.

QUOTE: Jim Carrey, a comic genius, has a harder time overcoming the public's desire for him to be funny simply because he's so good at it.

QUOTE: This is funny because I just had a job over the summer for VH1, a project I did called Strange Frequency where I got to play a Goth rock band singer.
AUTHOR: Charisma Carpenter

QUOTE: It's funny, the hardest thing to do is to make something look like it's fast, loose and improvised, and get somebody to laugh.
AUTHOR: Abel Ferrara

QUOTE: Sometimes I am so dry that people don't know I'm kidding and think I'm being serious. I enjoy this because their reactions are often funny.
AUTHOR: Robert Crais

QUOTE: It is easier for a father to have children than for children to have a real father.
AUTHOR: Pope John XXIII

QUOTE: When one has not had a good father, one must create one.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: I am not ashamed to say that no man I ever met was my father's equal, and I never loved any other man as much.

QUOTE: Whoever does not have a good father should procure one.

QUOTE: My father? I never knew him. Never even seen a picture of him.
AUTHOR: Eminem

QUOTE: I stopped loving my father a long time ago. What remained was the slavery to a pattern.
AUTHOR: Anais Nin

QUOTE: I made a decision when my father passed away that I was going to be who God made me to be and not try to preach like my father.
AUTHOR: Joel Osteen

QUOTE: My father was my teacher. But most importantly he was a great dad.
AUTHOR: Beau Bridges

QUOTE: The place of the father in the modern suburban family is a very small one, particularly if he plays golf.
AUTHOR: Bertrand Russell

QUOTE: Sons have always a rebellious wish to be disillusioned by that which charmed their fathers.
AUTHOR: Aldous Huxley

QUOTE: The fundamental defect of fathers, in our competitive society, is that they want their children to be a credit to them.
AUTHOR: Bertrand Russell

QUOTE: Fathers are biological necessities, but social accidents.
AUTHOR: Margaret Mead

QUOTE: I just wish I could understand my father.
AUTHOR: Michael Jackson

QUOTE: Babies don't need fathers, but mothers do. Someone who is taking care of a baby needs to be taken care of.

QUOTE: I pressed my father's hand and told him I would protect his grave with my life. My father smiled and passed away to the spirit land.
AUTHOR: Chief Joseph

QUOTE: A father is a man who expects his son to be as good a man as he meant to be.
AUTHOR: Frank A. Clark

QUOTE: I have never been a material girl. My father always told me never to love anything that cannot love you back.
AUTHOR: Imelda Marcos

QUOTE: All the learnin' my father paid for was a bit o' birch at one end and an alphabet at the other.
AUTHOR: George Eliot

QUOTE: Undeservedly you will atone for the sins of your fathers.
AUTHOR: Horace

QUOTE: Every parent is at some time the father of the unreturned prodigal, with nothing to do but keep his house open to hope.
AUTHOR: John Ciardi

QUOTE: My father was not a failure. After all, he was the father of a president of the United States.
AUTHOR: Harry S. Truman

QUOTE: It is much easier to become a father than to be one.
AUTHOR: Kent Nerburn

QUOTE: My father... had sharper eyes than the rest of our people.
AUTHOR: Chief Joseph

QUOTE: A father is always making his baby into a little woman. And when she is a woman he turns her back again.
AUTHOR: Enid Bagnold

QUOTE: I spent three days a week for 10 years educating myself in the public library, and it's better than college. People should educate themselves - you can get a complete education for no money. At the end of 10 years, I had read every book in the library and I'd written a thousand stories.
AUTHOR: Ray Bradbury

QUOTE: Education doesn't change life much. It just lifts trouble to a higher plane of regard.
AUTHOR: Robert Frost

QUOTE: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.
AUTHOR: Walt Disney

QUOTE: A human being is not attaining his full heights until he is educated.
AUTHOR: Horace Mann

QUOTE: Change is the end result of all true learning.
AUTHOR: Leo Buscaglia

QUOTE: The direction in which education starts a man will determine his future in life.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: No one has yet realized the wealth of sympathy, the kindness and generosity hidden in the soul of a child. The effort of every true education should be to unlock that treasure.

QUOTE: Why should society feel responsible only for the education of children, and not for the education of all adults of every age?

QUOTE: Education's purpose is to replace an empty mind with an open one.

QUOTE: Education is a better safeguard of liberty than a standing army.

QUOTE: America is becoming so educated that ignorance will be a novelty. I will belong to the select few.

QUOTE: Data is not information, information is not knowledge, knowledge is not understanding, understanding is not wisdom.

QUOTE: The illiterate of the future will not be the person who cannot read. It will be the person who does not know how to learn.

QUOTE: I am often amazed at how much more capability and enthusiasm for science there is among elementary school youngsters than among college students.

QUOTE: Education is simply the soul of a society as it passes from one generation to another.

QUOTE: Children have to be educated, but they have also to be left to educate themselves.

QUOTE: An educated person is one who has learned that information almost always turns out to be at best incomplete and very often false, misleading, fictitious, mendacious - just dead wrong.

QUOTE: Much education today is monumentally ineffective. All too often we are giving young people cut flowers when we should be teaching them to grow their own plants.

QUOTE: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books.
AUTHOR: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

QUOTE: I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning to sail my ship.
AUTHOR: Aeschylus

QUOTE: Good teaching is one-fourth preparation and three-fourths pure theatre.
AUTHOR: Gail Godwin

QUOTE: When I get a little money I buy books; and if any is left I buy food and clothes.
AUTHOR: Desiderius Erasmus

QUOTE: Education is learning what you didn't even know you didn't know.
AUTHOR: Daniel J. Boorstin

QUOTE: No man who worships education has got the best out of education... Without a gentle contempt for education no man's education is complete.
AUTHOR: Gilbert K. Chesterton

QUOTE: Patience and perseverance have a magical effect before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish.
AUTHOR: John Quincy Adams

QUOTE: Alcohol gives you infinite patience for stupidity.
AUTHOR: Sammy Davis, Jr.

QUOTE: Meekness: Uncommon patience in planning a revenge that is worth while.
AUTHOR: Ambrose Bierce

QUOTE: I grow plants for many reasons: to please my eye or to please my soul, to challenge the elements or to challenge my patience, for novelty or for nostalgia, but mostly for the joy in seeing them grow.

QUOTE: Faith is not simply a patience that passively suffers until the storm is past. Rather, it is a spirit that bears things - with resignations, yes, but above all, with blazing, serene hope.
AUTHOR: Corazon Aquino

QUOTE: And I love that even in the toughest moments, when we're all sweating it - when we're worried that the bill won't pass, and it seems like all is lost - Barack never lets himself get distracted by the chatter and the noise. Just like his grandmother, he just keeps getting up and moving forward... with patience and wisdom, and courage and grace.
AUTHOR: Michelle Obama

QUOTE: Patience is the ability to idle your motor when you feel like stripping your gears.
AUTHOR: Barbara Johnson

QUOTE: A garden is a grand teacher. It teaches patience and careful watchfulness; it teaches industry and thrift; above all it teaches entire trust.
AUTHOR: Gertrude Jekyll

QUOTE: We have no patience with other people's vanity because it is offensive to our own.
AUTHOR: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

QUOTE: To bear with patience wrongs done to oneself is a mark of perfection, but to bear with patience wrongs done to someone else is a mark of imperfection and even of actual sin.

QUOTE: Endurance is the crowning quality, And patience all the passion of great hearts.
AUTHOR: James Russell Lowell

QUOTE: Patience and tenacity are worth more than twice their weight of cleverness.

QUOTE: Everything that slows us down and forces patience, everything that sets us back into the slow circles of nature, is a help. Gardening is an instrument of grace.

QUOTE: I have not the smarts or patience for political office.
AUTHOR: Henry Rollins

QUOTE: Clearly older women and especially older women who have led an active life or elder women who successfully maneuver through their own family life have so much to teach us about sharing, patience, and wisdom.

AUTHOR: Ellen DeGeneres

QUOTE: You can learn many things from children. How much patience you have, for instance.
AUTHOR: Franklin P. Jones

QUOTE: When sorrows come, they come not single spies, but in battalions.
AUTHOR: William Shakespeare

QUOTE: When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: If there was less sympathy in the world, there would be less trouble in the world.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: What does love look like? It has the hands to help others. It has the feet to hasten to the poor and needy. It has eyes to see misery and want. It has the ears to hear the sighs and sorrows of men. That is what love looks like.
AUTHOR: Saint Augustine

QUOTE: We should feel sorrow, but not sink under its oppression.
AUTHOR: Confucius

QUOTE: Only by joy and sorrow does a person know anything about themselves and their destiny. They learn what to do and what to avoid.

QUOTE: Tears are the silent language of grief.

QUOTE: Sorrow can be alleviated by good sleep, a bath and a glass of wine.

QUOTE: Almost all of our sorrows spring out of our relations with other people.

QUOTE: Sorrow is a fruit. God does not make it grow on limbs too weak to bear it.

QUOTE: There is no greater sorrow than to recall happiness in times of misery.
AUTHOR: Dante Alighieri

QUOTE: There is no pain so great as the memory of joy in present grief.

QUOTE: Remember me with smiles and laughter, for that is how I will remember you all. If you can only remember me with tears, then don't remember me at all.

QUOTE: Happiness is beneficial for the body, but it is grief that develops the powers of the mind.

QUOTE: Excessive sorrow laughs. Excessive joy weeps.

QUOTE: Bear and endure: This sorrow will one day prove to be for your good.

QUOTE: I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow, but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.

QUOTE: Our trials, our sorrows, and our grieves develop us.
AUTHOR: Orison Swett Marden

QUOTE: There is no grief like the grief that does not speak.

QUOTE: It is for us to pray not for tasks equal to our powers, but for powers equal to our tasks, to go forward with a great desire forever beating at the door of our hearts as we travel toward our distant goal.

QUOTE: Hurt leads to bitterness, bitterness to anger, travel too far that road and the way is lost.

QUOTE: My reading of history convinces me that most bad government results from too much government.

QUOTE: Man is not free unless government is limited.

QUOTE: Government's first duty is to protect the people, not run their lives.

QUOTE: Government exists to protect us from each other. Where government has gone beyond its limits is in deciding to protect us from ourselves.

QUOTE: A Bill of Rights is what the people are entitled to against every government, and what no just government should refuse, or rest on inference.

QUOTE: The philosophy of the school room in one generation will be the philosophy of government in the next.

QUOTE: The problem is not that people are taxed too little, the problem is that government spends too much.

QUOTE: No government ever voluntarily reduces itself in size. Government programs, once launched, never disappear. Actually, a government bureau is the nearest thing to eternal life we'll ever see on this earth!

QUOTE: Loyalty to the country always. Loyalty to the government when it deserves it.

QUOTE: People want to hear what I have to say and respect what I say.

QUOTE: But really, we also need to learn how to love one another as women. How to appreciate and respect each other.

AUTHOR: Martin Luther King, Jr.

QUOTE: If we lose love and self respect for each other, this is how we finally die.

QUOTE: A fairly bright boy is far more intelligent and far better company than the average adult.
AUTHOR: John B. S. Haldane

QUOTE: Growing up, I've enjoyed hunting with my father.
AUTHOR: Dale Earnhardt

QUOTE: Adolescence is just one big walking pimple.
AUTHOR: Carol Burnett

QUOTE: Friendships in childhood are usually a matter of chance, whereas in adolescence they are most often a matter of choice.
AUTHOR: David Elkind

QUOTE: Growing up, I wanted desperately to please, to be a good girl.
AUTHOR: Claire Danes

QUOTE: Family life itself, that safest, most traditional, most approved of female choices, is not a sanctuary: It is, perpetually, a dangerous place.
AUTHOR: Margaret Drabble

QUOTE: The attempt to redefine the family as a purely voluntary arrangement grows out of the modern delusion that people can keep all their options open all the time.
AUTHOR: Christopher Lasch

QUOTE: Tennis just a game, family is forever.
AUTHOR: Serena Williams

QUOTE: I stay in tune with my family and God.
AUTHOR: Regina King

QUOTE: If we abandon marriage, we abandon the family.
AUTHOR: Michael Enzi

QUOTE: Pray in your family daily, that yours may be in the number of the families who call upon God.
AUTHOR: Christopher Love

QUOTE: I am tortured when I am away from my family, from my children. I am horribly guilt-ridden.
AUTHOR: Jessica Lange

QUOTE: I find the family the most mysterious and fascinating institution in the world.
AUTHOR: Amos Oz

QUOTE: A woman should be home with the children, building that home and making sure there's a secure family atmosphere.
AUTHOR: Mel Gibson

QUOTE: I mean, I look at my dad. He was twenty when he started having a family, and he was always the coolest dad. He did everything for his kids, and he never made us feel like he was pressured. I know that it must be a great feeling to be a guy like that.
AUTHOR: Adam Sandler

QUOTE: Some of the most important conversations I've ever had occurred at my family's dinner table.
AUTHOR: Bob Ehrlich

QUOTE: You have to defend your honor. And your family.
AUTHOR: Suzanne Vega

QUOTE: I consider my mom and all my sisters my friends.
AUTHOR: Alexa Vega

QUOTE: When you start about family, about lineage and ancestry, you are talking about every person on earth.
AUTHOR: Alex Haley

QUOTE: When I'm ready, I plan to adopt. I still believe in family.
AUTHOR: LaToya Jackson

QUOTE: The left dismisses talk about the collapse of family life and talks instead about the emergence of the growing new diversity of family types.
AUTHOR: Christopher Lasch

QUOTE: It's not that our family has no taste, it's just that our family's taste is inconsistent.
AUTHOR: Dave Eggers

QUOTE: There are things that you cannot talk to your mother and father about, there are things that you cannot talk to your children about.
AUTHOR: Shirley Knight

QUOTE: A woman can plan when to have her family and how to support a family.
AUTHOR: Kathleen Turner

QUOTE: When I was younger, my family would go camping and fishing on our ranches. My dad loves being around all kinds of animals. He's the one who got me to be a really big animal lover.
AUTHOR: Paris Hilton

QUOTE: I would rather start a family than finish one.
AUTHOR: Don Marquis

QUOTE: Parents need all the help they can get. The strongest as well as the most fragile family requires a vital network of social supports.
AUTHOR: Bernice Weissbourd

QUOTE: I'm not much of a family man. I'm just not that into it. I love kids, I adore them, but I don't want to live my life for them.
AUTHOR: Sting

QUOTE: I am the family face; flesh perishes, I live on.
AUTHOR: Thomas Hardy

QUOTE: I love cooking for myself and cooking for my family.
AUTHOR: Al Roker

QUOTE: A woman has to be intelligent, have charm, a sense of humor, and be kind. It's the same qualities I require from a man.
AUTHOR: Catherine Deneuve

QUOTE: There is a thin line that separates laughter and pain, comedy and tragedy, humor and hurt.
AUTHOR: Erma Bombeck

QUOTE: I think I have always had a little humor.
AUTHOR: Marilyn Monroe

QUOTE: Anybody with a sense of humor is going to put on my album and laugh from beginning to end.
AUTHOR: Eminem

QUOTE: Humor is the most engaging cowardice.
AUTHOR: Robert Frost

QUOTE: Good humor is a tonic for mind and body. It is the best antidote for anxiety and depression. It is a business asset. It attracts and keeps friends. It lightens human burdens. It is the direct route to serenity and contentment.
AUTHOR: Grenville Kleiser

QUOTE: I met Woz when I was 13, at a friend's garage. He was about 18. He was, like, the first person I met who knew more electronics than I did at that point. We became good friends, because we shared an interest in computer and we had a sense of humor. We pulled all kinds of pranks together.
AUTHOR: Steve Jobs

QUOTE: I think people are sexy when they have a sense of humor, when they are smart, when they have some sense of style, when they are kind, when they express their own opinions, when they are creative, when they have character.
AUTHOR: Suzanne Vega

QUOTE: The overwhelming majority of Americans are possessed of two great qualities a sense of humor and a sense of proportion.
AUTHOR: Franklin D. Roosevelt

QUOTE: Humor has been the balm of my life, but it's been reserved for those close to me, not part of the public Lana.
AUTHOR: Lana Turner

QUOTE: One of the things that binds us as a family is a shared sense of humor.
AUTHOR: Ralph Fiennes

QUOTE: Humor has justly been regarded as the finest perfection of poetic genius.
AUTHOR: Thomas Carlyle

QUOTE: There are men so philosophical that they can see humor in their own toothaches. But there has never lived a man so philosophical that he could see the toothache in his own humor.
AUTHOR: H. L. Mencken

QUOTE: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he isn't. A sense of humor was provided to console him for what he is.
AUTHOR: Horace Walpole

QUOTE: Being a Hot Mom means being respected as a mom and a woman. And, the key to being a Hot Mom is having a sense of humor about yourself and all the crazy situations that arise.
AUTHOR: Jami Gertz

QUOTE: Any man who has had the job I've had and didn't have a sense of humor wouldn't still be here.
AUTHOR: Harry S. Truman

QUOTE: Women, as they grow older, rely more and more on cosmetics. Men, as they grow older, rely more and more on a sense of humor.
AUTHOR: George Jean Nathan

QUOTE: I think the scariest person in the world is the person with no sense of humor.
AUTHOR: Michael J. Fox

QUOTE: A sense of humor keen enough to show a man his own absurdities will keep him from the commission of all sins, or nearly all, save those worth committing.
AUTHOR: Samuel Butler

QUOTE: Good humor is one of the best articles of dress one can wear in society.
AUTHOR: William Makepeace Thackeray

QUOTE: My experiences have taught me a lot and I'm happy with my learnings, if not with what I went through to learn.
AUTHOR: Ally Sheedy

QUOTE: An optimist is a guy that has never had much experience.
AUTHOR: Don Marquis

QUOTE: Your experiences will be yours alone. But truth and best friendship will rarely if ever disappoint you.
AUTHOR: Anne Lamott

QUOTE: Experience is the only prophecy of wise men.
AUTHOR: Alphonse de Lamartine

QUOTE: My path has not been determined. I shall have more experiences and pass many more milestones.
AUTHOR: Agnetha Faltskog

QUOTE: Experience comprises illusions lost, rather than wisdom gained.
AUTHOR: Joseph Roux

QUOTE: Experience is a great teacher.
AUTHOR: John Legend

QUOTE: If you want to know the taste of a pear, you must change the pear by eating it yourself. If you want to know the theory and methods of revolution, you must take part in revolution. All genuine knowledge originates in direct experience.
AUTHOR: Mao Zedong

QUOTE: Experience has taught me, when I am shaving of a morning, to keep watch over my thoughts, because, if a line of poetry strays into my memory, my skin bristles so that the razor ceases to act.
AUTHOR: A. E. Housman

QUOTE: All experience is an arch, to build upon.
AUTHOR: Henry Adams

QUOTE: Experiences are savings which a miser puts aside. Wisdom is an inheritance which a wastrel cannot exhaust.
AUTHOR: Karl Kraus

QUOTE: The main thing experience has taught me is that one has to sort of hone their relationship to time, you know.
AUTHOR: John Frusciante

QUOTE: Few people even scratch the surface, much less exhaust the contemplation of their own experience.
AUTHOR: Randolph Bourne

QUOTE: Judgment comes from experience - and experience comes from bad judgment.
AUTHOR: Walter Wriston

QUOTE: I think we are a product of all our experiences.
AUTHOR: Sanford I. Weill

QUOTE: Most of the images of reality on which we base our actions are really based on vicarious experience.
AUTHOR: Albert Bandura

QUOTE: Information's pretty thin stuff unless mixed with experience.
AUTHOR: Clarence Day

QUOTE: Nothing which has entered into our experience is ever lost.
AUTHOR: William Ellery Channing

QUOTE: Everything is discursive opinion instead of direct experience.
AUTHOR: A. R. Ammons

QUOTE: Color is an intense experience on its own.
AUTHOR: Jim Hodges

QUOTE: Not the fruit of experience, but experience itself, is the end.
AUTHOR: Walter Pater

QUOTE: One thorn of experience is worth a whole wilderness of warning.
AUTHOR: James Russell Lowell

QUOTE: Prestige is the shadow of money and power.
AUTHOR: C. Wright Mills

QUOTE: Unlimited power corrupts the possessor.
AUTHOR: William Pitt

QUOTE: America has a critical role to play as the most powerful member of the world community.
AUTHOR: Adam Schiff

QUOTE: Every crisis offers you extra desired power.
AUTHOR: William Moulton Marston

QUOTE: Power and position often make a man trifle with the truth.
AUTHOR: George A. Smith

QUOTE: I believe in the power of weakness.
AUTHOR: Pat Buckley

QUOTE: The way to have power is to take it.
AUTHOR: Boss Tweed

QUOTE: Each underestimates her own power and overestimates the other's.
AUTHOR: Deborah Tannen

QUOTE: The law has no power over heroes.
AUTHOR: Charlotte Lennox

QUOTE: There are two ways of attaining an important end, force and perseverance; the silent power of the latter grows irresistible with time.
AUTHOR: Sophie Swetchine

QUOTE: Ironically, women who acquire power are more likely to be criticized for it than are the men who have always had it.
AUTHOR: Carolyn Heilbrun

QUOTE: Next to power without honor, the most dangerous thing in the world is power without humor.
AUTHOR: Eric Sevareid

QUOTE: I, not events, have the power to make me happy or unhappy today. I can choose which it shall be. Yesterday is dead, tomorrow hasn't arrived yet. I have just one day, today, and I'm going to be happy in it.
AUTHOR: Groucho Marx

QUOTE: There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition, and of unspeakable love.
AUTHOR: Washington Irving

QUOTE: The attempt to combine wisdom and power has only rarely been successful and then only for a short while.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: You will know that forgiveness has begun when you recall those who hurt you and feel the power to wish them well.
AUTHOR: Lewis B. Smedes

QUOTE: It is not in the nature of politics that the best men should be elected. The best men do not want to govern their fellowmen.
AUTHOR: George MacDonald

QUOTE: Pollution is nothing but the resources we are not harvesting. We allow them to disperse because we've been ignorant of their value.
AUTHOR: R. Buckminster Fuller

QUOTE: An idea not coupled with action will never get any bigger than the brain cell it occupied.
AUTHOR: Arnold H. Glasow

QUOTE: When one may pay out over two million dollars to presidential and Congressional campaigns, the U.S. government is virtually up for sale.
AUTHOR: John W. Gardner

QUOTE: Power tends to corrupt and absolute power corrupts absolutely.
AUTHOR: Lord Acton

QUOTE: Republicans are men of narrow vision, who are afraid of the future.

QUOTE: The activist is not the man who says the river is dirty. The activist is the man who cleans up the river.

QUOTE: When I was a boy I was told that anybody could become President; I'm beginning to believe it.

QUOTE: A liberal is a man who is willing to spend somebody else's money.
AUTHOR: Carter Glass

QUOTE: For every talent that poverty has stimulated it has blighted a hundred.
AUTHOR: John W. Gardner

QUOTE: Democracy is being allowed to vote for the candidate you dislike least.
AUTHOR: Robert Byrne

QUOTE: If we desire respect for the law, we must first make the law respectable.
AUTHOR: Louis D. Brandeis

QUOTE: In order to become the master, the politician poses as the servant.
AUTHOR: Charles de Gaulle

QUOTE: Republicans have nothing but bad ideas and Democrats have no ideas.
AUTHOR: Lewis Black

QUOTE: The end move in politics is always to pick up a gun.
AUTHOR: R. Buckminster Fuller

QUOTE: In politics nothing is contemptible.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Disraeli

QUOTE: In most places in the country, voting is looked upon as a right and a duty, but in Chicago it's a sport.
AUTHOR: Dick Gregory

QUOTE: I know many writers who first dictate passages, then polish what they have dictated. I speak, then I polish - occasionally I do windows.
AUTHOR: Ed Koch

QUOTE: Liberalism is trust of the people tempered by prudence. Conservatism is distrust of the people tempered by fear.

QUOTE: You may think the president is all-powerful, but he is not. He needs a lot of guidance from the Lord.

QUOTE: Our whole constitutional heritage rebels at the thought of giving government the power to control men's minds.

QUOTE: You cannot spend your way out of recession or borrow your way out of debt.

QUOTE: A conservative is a man who just sits and thinks, mostly sits.
AUTHOR: Woodrow Wilson

QUOTE: America's present need is not heroics but healing; not nostrums but normalcy; not revolution but restoration.

QUOTE: And while the law of competition may be sometimes hard for the individual, it is best for the race, because it ensures the survival of the fittest in every department.

QUOTE: Try, try, try, and keep on trying is the rule that must be followed to become an expert in anything.

QUOTE: Business, more than any other occupation, is a continual dealing with the future; it is a continual calculation, an instinctive exercise in foresight.

QUOTE: Our business is infested with idiots who try to impress by using pretentious jargon.

QUOTE: An organization's ability to learn, and translate that learning into action rapidly, is the ultimate competitive advantage.

QUOTE: Sales are contingent upon the attitude of the salesman - not the attitude of the prospect.

QUOTE: The entrepreneur always searches for change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity.

QUOTE: About the time we can make the ends meet, somebody moves the ends.

QUOTE: Profit in business comes from repeat customers, customers that boast about your project or service, and that bring friends with them.

QUOTE: The invisible hand of the market always moves faster and better than the heavy hand of government.

QUOTE: Business is a combination of war and sport.
AUTHOR: Andre Maurois

QUOTE: Employees make the best dates. You don't have to pick them up and they're always tax-deductible.

QUOTE: Anyone who has lost track of time when using a computer knows the propensity to dream, the urge to make dreams come true and the tendency to miss lunch.

QUOTE: It takes more than capital to swing business. You've got to have the A. I. D. degree to get by - Advertising, Initiative, and Dynamics.

QUOTE: When times are bad is when the real entrepreneurs emerge.
AUTHOR: Robert Kiyosaki

QUOTE: As a small businessperson, you have no greater leverage than the truth.

QUOTE: The first responsibility of a leader is to define reality. The last is to say thank you. In between, the leader is a servant.

QUOTE: Time is the scarcest resource and unless it is managed nothing else can be managed.
AUTHOR: Peter Drucker

QUOTE: An advertising agency is 85 percent confusion and 15 percent commission.

QUOTE: Start with good people, lay out the rules, communicate with your employees, motivate them and reward them. If you do all those things effectively, you can't miss.

QUOTE: The gambling known as business looks with austere disfavor upon the business known as gambling.
AUTHOR: Ambrose Bierce

QUOTE: In modern business it is not the crook who is to be feared most, it is the honest man who doesn't know what he is doing.
AUTHOR: William Wordsworth

QUOTE: If you owe the bank $100 that's your problem. If you owe the bank $100 million, that's the bank's problem.

QUOTE: Wise are those who learn that the bottom line doesn't always have to be their top priority.
AUTHOR: William Arthur Ward

QUOTE: When you make the sacrifice in marriage, you're sacrificing not to each other but to unity in a relationship.

QUOTE: Let us now set forth one of the fundamental truths about marriage: the wife is in charge.

QUOTE: I'd marry again if I found a man who had fifteen million dollars, would sign over half to me, and guarantee that he'd be dead within a year.

QUOTE: Marriage is a great institution, but I'm not ready for an institution.

QUOTE: If you want to sacrifice the admiration of many men for the criticism of one, go ahead, get married.

QUOTE: All men make mistakes, but married men find out about them sooner.

QUOTE: Bachelors know more about women than married men; if they didn't they'd be married too.

QUOTE: My husband and I are best of friends first and foremost. We fight like cats and dogs, but never stay mad for long. I was lucky to find him, he is in every way, my soulmate.
