QUOTE: A journey is like marriage. The certain way to be wrong is to think you control it.
AUTHOR: John Steinbeck

QUOTE: No man should marry until he has studied anatomy and dissected at least one woman.
AUTHOR: Honore de Balzac

QUOTE: To keep your marriage brimming, With love in the loving cup, Whenever you're wrong, admit it; Whenever you're right, shut up.
AUTHOR: Ogden Nash

QUOTE: Never get married in college; it's hard to get a start if a prospective employer finds you've already made one mistake.
AUTHOR: Elbert Hubbard

QUOTE: A man in love is incomplete until he has married. Then he's finished.

QUOTE: He's the kind of man a woman would have to marry to get rid of.
AUTHOR: Mae West

QUOTE: Politics doesn't make strange bedfellows - marriage does.
AUTHOR: Groucho Marx

QUOTE: Love: A temporary insanity curable by marriage.
AUTHOR: Ambrose Bierce

QUOTE: It's tough to stay married. My wife kisses the dog on the lips, yet she won't drink from my glass.
AUTHOR: Rodney Dangerfield

QUOTE: Marriage has no guarantees. If that's what you're looking for, go live with a car battery.
AUTHOR: Erma Bombeck

QUOTE: Marrying an old bachelor is like buying second-hand furniture.
AUTHOR: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

QUOTE: Well married a person has wings, poorly married shackles.
AUTHOR: Henry Ward Beecher

QUOTE: A successful marriage is an edifice that must be rebuilt every day.
AUTHOR: Andre Maurois

QUOTE: When a man opens a car door for his wife, it's either a new car or a new wife.
AUTHOR: Prince Philip

QUOTE: Many men owe the grandeur of their lives to their tremendous difficulties.
AUTHOR: Charles Spurgeon

QUOTE: By indignities men come to dignities.
AUTHOR: Francis Bacon

QUOTE: Men do not quit playing because they grow old; they grow old because they quit playing.
AUTHOR: Oliver Wendell Holmes

QUOTE: Men give away nothing so liberally as their advice.
AUTHOR: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

QUOTE: I am an agnostic; I do not pretend to know what many ignorant men are sure of.
AUTHOR: Clarence Darrow

QUOTE: There is no such thing as justice in the abstract; it is merely a compact between men.
AUTHOR: Epicurus

QUOTE: When men and women agree, it is only in their conclusions; their reasons are always different.
AUTHOR: George Santayana

QUOTE: Pride, envy, avarice - these are the sparks have set on fire the hearts of all men.
AUTHOR: Dante Alighieri

QUOTE: Nothing is as peevish and pedantic as men's judgments of one another.
AUTHOR: Desiderius Erasmus

QUOTE: Men's arguments often prove nothing but their wishes.
AUTHOR: Charles Caleb Colton

QUOTE: Those men get along best with women who can get along best without them.
AUTHOR: Charles Baudelaire

QUOTE: Luck is not something you can mention in the presence of self-made men.
AUTHOR: E. B. White

QUOTE: Men aren't necessities. They're luxuries.
AUTHOR: Cher

QUOTE: The duty of comedy is to correct men by amusing them.
AUTHOR: Moliere

QUOTE: All men who have turned out worth anything have had the chief hand in their own education.
AUTHOR: Walter Scott

QUOTE: Men are not punished for their sins, but by them.
AUTHOR: Kin Hubbard

QUOTE: There would be no great men if there were no little ones.
AUTHOR: George Herbert

QUOTE: Men should strive to think much and know little.
AUTHOR: Democritus

QUOTE: Men are freest when they are most unconscious of freedom. The shout is a rattling of chains, always was.

QUOTE: It is the privilege of the gods to want nothing, and of godlike men to want little.
AUTHOR: Diogenes

QUOTE: When two men in business always agree, one of them is unnecessary.

QUOTE: Men often act knowingly against their interest.
AUTHOR: David Hume

QUOTE: Men and women have strengths that complement each other.
AUTHOR: Edwin Louis Cole

QUOTE: Delight at having understood a very abstract and obscure system leads most people to believe in the truth of what it demonstrates.
AUTHOR: Georg C. Lichtenberg

QUOTE: Read nature; nature is a friend to truth.
AUTHOR: Edward Young

QUOTE: A great truth is a truth whose opposite is also a truth.
AUTHOR: Thomas Mann

QUOTE: Truth makes many appeals, not the least of which is its power to shock.
AUTHOR: Jules Renard

QUOTE: He who sees the truth, let him proclaim it, without asking who is for it or who is against it.
AUTHOR: Henry George

QUOTE: Some artists shrink from self-awareness, fearing that it will destroy their unique gifts and even their desire to create. The truth of the matter is quite opposite.
AUTHOR: James Broughton

QUOTE: Eternal truth, eternal righteousness, eternal love; these only can triumph, for these only can endure.
AUTHOR: Joseph Barber Lightfoot

QUOTE: Confidence and superiority: It's the usual fundamentalist stuff: I've got the truth, and you haven't.
AUTHOR: Jeanette Winterson

QUOTE: Every night I go over what I did in the day, in ethical or moral terms. Have I treated people properly? Did I tell the truth?
AUTHOR: Jeanne Moreau

QUOTE: I make one pledge above all others - to seek and speak the truth with all the resources of mind and spirit I command.
AUTHOR: George McGovern

QUOTE: I think people must wonder how a white girl like me became a blues guitarist. The truth is, I never intended to do this for a living.
AUTHOR: Bonnie Raitt

QUOTE: There are times when we must sink to the bottom of our misery to understand truth, just as we must descend to the bottom of a well to see the stars in broad daylight.
AUTHOR: Vaclav Havel

QUOTE: Well, the first thing is that truth and power for me form an antithesis, an antagonism, which will hardly ever be resolved. I can define in fact, can simplify the history of human society, the evolution of human society, as a contest between power and freedom.
AUTHOR: Wole Soyinka

QUOTE: The Assembly has witnessed over the last weeks how historical truth is established; once an allegation has been repeated a few times, it is no longer an allegation, it is an established fact, even if no evidence has been brought out in order to support it.
AUTHOR: Dag Hammarskjold

QUOTE: Nobody speaks the truth when there is something they must have.
AUTHOR: Elizabeth Bowen

QUOTE: Then I despair... I remember that all through history, the way of truth and love has always won. There have been murderers and tyrants, and for a time they can seem invincible. But in the end they always fall. Think of it always.
AUTHOR: Andre Malraux

QUOTE: The source of all the material comes from nothingness, illusion is working more on things you can prove. That's the principle, the essence of life, it is actually an illusion, not immaterial. That's worth pursuing. So illusion is not nothing. In a way, that is the truth.
AUTHOR: Ang Lee

QUOTE: One of the grand fundamental principles of Mormonism is to receive truth, let it come from whence it may.
AUTHOR: Joseph Smith, Jr.

QUOTE: Understanding is a three-edged sword. Your side, my side, and the truth.
AUTHOR: J. Michael Straczynski

QUOTE: Learning is always rebellion... Every bit of new truth discovered is revolutionary to what was believed before.
AUTHOR: Margaret Lee Runbeck

QUOTE: Not that I regret saying what I believed to be the truth, but I regret anything that I might have written or spoken that could have been used in a way to help to foster that atmosphere out of which came the loss of life of Brother Malcolm.
AUTHOR: Louis Farrakhan

QUOTE: The audience is the barometer of the truth.
AUTHOR: Barbra Streisand

QUOTE: I'm interested in the truth, and unauthorized biographies are not. Yes, I would like to correct those errors someday.
AUTHOR: Barbra Streisand

QUOTE: The sad truth is that without complex business partnerships between African elites and European traders and commercial agents, the slave trade to the New World would have been impossible, at least on the scale it occurred.
AUTHOR: Henry Louis Gates

QUOTE: Man may aspire to virtue, but he cannot reasonably aspire to truth.
AUTHOR: Nicolas Chamfort

QUOTE: Love takes off masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.
AUTHOR: James A. Baldwin

QUOTE: How absurd and delicious it is to be in love with somebody younger than yourself. Everybody should try it.
AUTHOR: Barbara Pym

QUOTE: Love is the only reality and it is not a mere sentiment. It is the ultimate truth that lies at the heart of creation.
AUTHOR: Rabindranath Tagore

QUOTE: Absence - that common cure of love.
AUTHOR: Lord Byron

QUOTE: Love consists in this, that two solitudes protect and touch and greet each other.
AUTHOR: Rainer Maria Rilke

QUOTE: There is no disguise which can hide love for long where it exists, or simulate it where it does not.
AUTHOR: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

QUOTE: A kiss is a rosy dot over the 'i' of loving.
AUTHOR: Cyrano de Bergerac

QUOTE: Love is supreme and unconditional; like is nice but limited.
AUTHOR: Duke Ellington

QUOTE: Looking back, I have this to regret, that too often when I loved, I did not say so.
AUTHOR: David Grayson

QUOTE: Be of love a little more careful than of anything.
AUTHOR: e. e. cummings

QUOTE: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
AUTHOR: Emily Bronte

QUOTE: Love is the greatest refreshment in life.
AUTHOR: Pablo Picasso

QUOTE: Lord, grant that I might not so much seek to be loved as to love.
AUTHOR: Francis of Assisi

QUOTE: Gestures, in love, are incomparably more attractive, effective and valuable than words.
AUTHOR: Francois Rabelais

QUOTE: People think love is an emotion. Love is good sense.
AUTHOR: Ken Kesey

QUOTE: I believe in the compelling power of love. I do not understand it. I believe it to be the most fragrant blossom of all this thorny existence.
AUTHOR: Theodore Dreiser

QUOTE: Love knows not distance; it hath no continent; its eyes are for the stars.
AUTHOR: Gilbert Parker

QUOTE: Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.
AUTHOR: David Byrne

QUOTE: The sweetest of all sounds is that of the voice of the woman we love.
AUTHOR: Jean de la Bruyere

QUOTE: There is a woman at the begining of all great things.
AUTHOR: Alphonse de Lamartine

QUOTE: When we are in love we seem to ourselves quite different from what we were before.
AUTHOR: Blaise Pascal

QUOTE: Tell me who admires and loves you, and I will tell you who you are.
AUTHOR: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

QUOTE: The degree of loving is measured by the degree of giving.
AUTHOR: Edwin Louis Cole

QUOTE: There is only one kind of love, but there are a thousand imitations.
AUTHOR: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

QUOTE: If you wished to be loved, love.
AUTHOR: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

QUOTE: The best teacher is the one who suggests rather than dogmatizes, and inspires his listener with the wish to teach himself.
AUTHOR: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

QUOTE: A true teacher defends his students against his own personal influences.
AUTHOR: Amos Bronson Alcott

QUOTE: The most important part of teaching is to teach what it is to know.
AUTHOR: Simone Weil

QUOTE: My goal is to get home every day in time for dinner with the family - and then we play with the kids for a while, and then I go to bed around the time they do and sleep from nine to three or nine to four. It's the same six hours everyone else gets. I'd just rather do my e-mails and my reading in the morning rather than late at night, that's all.

QUOTE: Integrate what you believe in every single area of your life. Take your heart to work and ask the most and best of everybody else, too.

QUOTE: War is at its best barbarism.

QUOTE: Cats are inquisitive, but hate to admit it.

AUTHOR: George Bernard Shaw

QUOTE: To me, 'Scream' is a masterpiece on every level - the performances, the humor, the tone - it's just flawless.

QUOTE: As I write, I control my anxiety and anguish thanks to the invaluable aid of irony and humor. QUOTE: Mental communication without verbalization... all space is made up of waves and we are constantly sending and receiving messages from our brain.

QUOTE: It is vital that the United States maintains open lines of communication with our allies. We must assure them of our commitment to eradicating global terrorism wherever it may reside or wherever it's given haven.

QUOTE: You know, my dad wasn't a photographer or filmmaker by profession, but on Sundays, he would take pictures of me and my family or his pals horseback riding, and it was a means of communication and affection, a means of not being so dysfunctional with each other.

QUOTE: I have seen that technology has contributed to improved communication, that it's contributed to better health care, that it's contributed to better food supplies, that it has contributed to all the basic human needs.

QUOTE: Tim and Fritz Lang I loved working with. Not Hitchcock so much. There was no communication.

QUOTE: I work on OpenBSD fulltime, as the project leader. I set some directions, increase communication between the developers, and try to be involved in nearly every aspect of the base system.

QUOTE: In 1984, I turned to theater in the hopes of finding a more direct form of communication between me and my people.

QUOTE: Art must unquestionably have a social value; that is, as a potential means of communication it must be addressed, and in comprehensible terms, to the understanding of mankind.

QUOTE: A poem might be defined as thinking about feelings - about human feelings and frailties.

AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: I don't think I've ever read poetry, ever.
AUTHOR: Eminem

QUOTE: Health consists with temperance alone.

AUTHOR: Elizabeth Gilbert

QUOTE: Christmas is a season for kindling the fire for hospitality in the hall, the genial flame of charity in the heart.

QUOTE: Whatever enlarges hope will also exalt courage.

QUOTE: I was raised by a lady that was crippled all her life but she did everything for me and she raised me. She washed our clothes, cooked our food, she did everything for us. AUTHOR: Jacques Pepin

QUOTE: When I pair food and wine, I start with the food. If I have a beautiful roasted bird, I might choose a Cabernet or Pinot Noir, or maybe a Syrah, depending on the sauce and what is in my cellar.

QUOTE: When I wrote 'Fast Food My Way' in 2004, I hoped that my friends would prepare my recipes. Now, more people cook from that book than any other I've written in the past 30 years.

QUOTE: I think there is a real misconception about Indian food being super spicy. And I know that's because when you go into an Indian restaurant, it is pretty spicy. But it doesn't have to be. In fact, my husband can't handle a lot of heat. I've had to temper my cooking so that he can eat with me.
AUTHOR: Aarti Sequeira

QUOTE: This June, I'll travel once again to the Food and Wine Magazine Classic in Aspen, Colorado. For many years, my dear friend Julia Child and I have teamed up to teach classes together at the event; for the past seven years, my daughter, Claudine, has been my cooking partner on stage.
AUTHOR: Jacques Pepin

QUOTE: Man's survival, from the time of Adam and Eve until the invention of agriculture, must have been precarious because of his inability to ensure his food supply.

QUOTE: I'm nutty for nutrition. I've become one of those people who can't stop talking about the connection between food and health. Now that I know how much changing what you eat can transform your life, I can't stop proselytizing.

QUOTE: I think it would be a lot easier if I said, 'I feel like a dude,' but I was raised by a southern mom, so I know how to put on lipstick and walk in heels and rock that look. It's exactly that juxtaposition that confuses people.
AUTHOR: Saskia de Brauw

QUOTE: Losing my mom at such a young age had a profound effect on my life.
AUTHOR: Molly Shannon

QUOTE: My mom is two people to me. She's my mom number one, and then she's this lady most comedians know as being a legendary owner of a nightclub that's responsible for starting a lot of heavy careers.
AUTHOR: Pauly Shore

QUOTE: I'm not sure what I want to do when I grow up, or if I'm sure I ever want to grow up. I'm sure there are people that wish I would, but you know, my mom will get over it.
AUTHOR: Jerry Doyle

QUOTE: Well I was eight years old, and I have an older cousin who is three years older than me and she was doing acting, commercials, and modeling at the time and... to see my cousin doing that was really inspiring and I wanted to do it. So I went to my mom and I asked her if I could do it, and for the acting part of it, she made me study for a year.
AUTHOR: Hailee Steinfeld

QUOTE: My dad is a successful television producer, director and writer and my mom's a director and writer.
AUTHOR: Troian Bellisario

QUOTE: Starting at age four, my mom decided that she was not going to have an idle child in the house. So I started taking dance lessons on Tuesdays and Thursdays, and then I was in acting classes on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, and I was also modeling on Saturdays. And that was my childhood.
AUTHOR: Chandra Wilson

QUOTE: I want to work, but being a mom is my No. 1 priority.
AUTHOR: Gena Lee Nolin

QUOTE: I think of myself as a fairly attractive girl and always have, thanks to my mom. I was brought into this world thinking I was gorgeous because my mother was extremely devoted to this notion.
AUTHOR: Amy Schumer

QUOTE: I hope that through my work, artists will take some chances, break some rules, and make art that comes from inside of them. I would like to be remembered as a kind person, a great Mom, and a bit unruly - in a good way!
AUTHOR: Angela Cartwright

QUOTE: When you become a mom you just learn how to function sleep deprived and you do get used to it. I came back to work when Finley was three months old and the first few months were rough. Then somehow you learn to exist on no sleep and now when he does upon occasion sleep through the night, which is like a full six hours, you're pretty sure he's suffocating. So you don't sleep anyway.
AUTHOR: Holly Marie Combs

QUOTE: People close to me called me 'Curry in a Hurry.' I was moving through life at 100 miles an hour trying to further my career and be a great mom and make everyone happy.
AUTHOR: Ann Curry

QUOTE: When I was little, we lived on 8 acres and my mom had a horse. But when I was 7, my mom kicked my dad out, and then in order to feed us five kids, she got critters cheap or for free and raised them for food. We milked a cow, raised chickens, pigs and beef cattle. We heated our one-story house with wood and stayed cold all winter.
AUTHOR: Bonnie Jo Campbell

QUOTE: I think my first big purchase was actually for my mom. She had one of those '90s TVs in her living room that's like a 10x10 brick, so I purchased her a flatscreen for her living room.
AUTHOR: Dave Franco

QUOTE: When I was six years old my friend was auditioning for 'Annie,' and I decided I wanted to audition with her. My mom was worried I would fall flat on my face because I'd never opened my mouth to sing, so she sent me to vocal lessons. I did the audition and fell in love with the entire process of a show.
AUTHOR: Jacqueline Emerson

QUOTE: I think I'm going to spend some time learning how to be a first-time mom, and then I'll go back to work.
AUTHOR: Linda Cardellini

QUOTE: Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it.
AUTHOR: C. S. Lewis

QUOTE: When in doubt tell the truth.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Truth is mighty and will prevail. There is nothing wrong with this, except that it ain't so.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Why shouldn't truth be stranger than fiction? Fiction, after all, has to make sense.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities. Truth isn't.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Man will occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of the time he will pick himself up and continue on.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: We occasionally stumble over the truth but most of us pick ourselves up and hurry off as if nothing had happened.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: Ignorance is preferable to error, and he is less remote from the truth who believes nothing than he who believes what is wrong.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: There is not a truth existing which I fear... or would wish unknown to the whole world.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: All the religions of the world, while they may differ in other respects, unitedly proclaim that nothing lives in this world but Truth.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: And we should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once. And we should call every truth false which was not accompanied by at least one laugh.

QUOTE: For Africa to me... is more than a glamorous fact. It is a historical truth. No man can know where he is going unless he knows exactly where he has been and exactly how he arrived at his present place.
AUTHOR: Maya Angelou

QUOTE: Truth stands, even if there be no public support. It is self-sustained.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: My way of joking is to tell the truth. That's the funniest joke in the world.
AUTHOR: Muhammad Ali

QUOTE: My religion is based on truth and non-violence. Truth is my God. Non-violence is the means of realising Him.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: Mothers always find ways to fit in the work - but then when you're working, you feel that you should be spending time with your children and then when you're with your children, you're thinking about working.
AUTHOR: Alice Hoffman

QUOTE: My mother used to tell me man gives the award, God gives the reward. I don't need another plaque.
AUTHOR: Denzel Washington

QUOTE: It's the moms of this nation - single, married, widowed - who really hold this country together. You're the ones who always have to do a little more.

QUOTE: The fastest way to break the cycle of perfectionism and become a fearless mother is to give up the idea of doing it perfectly - indeed to embrace uncertainty and imperfection.

QUOTE: Motherhood has a very humanizing effect. Everything gets reduced to essentials.

QUOTE: Throughout my life, my mom has been the person that I've always looked up to.

QUOTE: When motherhood becomes the fruit of a deep yearning, not the result of ignorance or accident, its children will become the foundation of a new race.

QUOTE: Only mothers can think of the future - because they give birth to it in their children.

QUOTE: Motherhood is priced Of God, at price no man may dare To lessen or misunderstand.

QUOTE: What do girls do who haven't any mothers to help them through their troubles?

QUOTE: The Vatican is against surrogate mothers. Good thing they didn't have that rule when Jesus was born.

QUOTE: Of all the roles I've played, none has been as fulfilling as being a mother.

QUOTE: My mom always said that there would be haters. Not everyone can love ya.

QUOTE: Mothers are the necessity of invention.

QUOTE: I was raised by a single mother who made a way for me. AUTHOR: Al Sharpton

QUOTE: I stand fearlessly for small dogs, the American Flag, motherhood and the Bible. That's why people love me.

QUOTE: I may be the only mother in America who knows exactly what their child is up to all the time.

QUOTE: I was a brownie for a day. My mom made me stop. She didn't want me to conform.

QUOTE: There are only two things a child will share willingly; communicable diseases and its mother's age.

QUOTE: My mother was a personal friend of God's. They had ongoing conversations.

QUOTE: Where there is a mother in the home, matters go well.

QUOTE: An angry man is again angry with himself when he returns to reason.

QUOTE: Anger is as a stone cast into a wasp's nest.

QUOTE: Expressing anger is a form of public littering.

QUOTE: There was never an angry man that thought his anger unjust.

QUOTE: I don't usually lose my temper, but if I get angry, it's true - I'm scary.

QUOTE: I get angry about things, then go on and work.

QUOTE: He that will be angry for anything will be angry for nothing.

QUOTE: Sometimes, you have to get angry to get things done.

QUOTE: Ridicule is the first and last argument of a fool.

QUOTE: Anger is an expensive luxury in which only men of certain income can indulge.

QUOTE: My father was often angry when I was most like him.

QUOTE: Our promise to our children should be this: if you do well in school, we will pay for you to obtain a college degree.

QUOTE: A few months after graduation I was working in films. It took off pretty quick.

AUTHOR: Dianna Agron

QUOTE: I am putting real plums into an imaginary cake.

QUOTE: The imagination imitates. It is the critical spirit that creates.

QUOTE: Anyone who lives within his means suffers from a lack of imagination.

QUOTE: With the brush we merely tint, while the imagination alone produces colour.

QUOTE: Television contracts the imagination and radio expands it.

QUOTE: One lifetime is never enough to accomplish one's horticultural goals. If a garden is a site for the imagination, how can we be very far from the beginning?

QUOTE: You don't have to fear defeat if you believe it may reveal powers that you didn't know you possessed.

QUOTE: I remember being onstage once when I didn't have fear: I got so scared I didn't have fear that it brought on an anxiety attack.

QUOTE: My greatest fear is disappointing the reader, so each book has to be better than the one before.

QUOTE: Fools rush in where incumbents fear to tread.

QUOTE: Most of us harbour a significant amount of subconscious fear about death, and act out of this fear in our daily lives.

QUOTE: Courage is... the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.
AUTHOR: David Ben-Gurion

QUOTE: But to be the best, you must face the best. And to overcome your fear, you must deal with the best.

QUOTE: By action and reaction do we become strong or weak, according to the character of our thoughts and mental states. Fear is the deadly nightshade of the mind.

AUTHOR: David Walliams

QUOTE: Peace is that state in which fear of any kind is unknown.

QUOTE: I take my children everywhere, but they always find their way back home.

QUOTE: Artists know that diligence counts as much, if not more, as inspiration; in art, as in politics, patience counts as much as revolution.

QUOTE: Sad Patience, too near neighbour to despair.

QUOTE: I love chicken. I would eat chicken fingers on Thanksgiving if it were socially acceptable.

QUOTE: There are two barriers that often prevent communication between the young and their elders. The first is middle-aged forgetfulness of the fact that they themselves are no longer young. The second is youthful ignorance of the fact that the middle aged are still alive.

QUOTE: A monopoly on the means of communication may define a ruling elite more precisely than the celebrated Marxian formula of monopoly in the means of production.

QUOTE: It's a fact that more people watch television and get their information that way than read books. I find new technology and new ways of communication very exciting and would like to do more in this field.
AUTHOR: Stephen Covey

QUOTE: But communication is two-sided - vital and profound communication makes demands also on those who are to receive it... demands in the sense of concentration, of genuine effort to receive what is being communicated.
AUTHOR: Roger Sessions

QUOTE: Nurses serve their patients in the most important capacities. We know that they serve as our first lines of communication when something goes wrong or when we are concerned about health.
AUTHOR: Lois Capps

QUOTE: Our most tragic error may have been our inability to establish a rapport and a confidence with the press and television with the communication media. I don't think the press has understood me.

QUOTE: Evil communication corrupts good manners. I hope to live to hear that good communication corrects bad manners.

QUOTE: Societies have always been shaped more by the nature of the media by which men communicate than by the content of the communication.
AUTHOR: Marshall McLuhan

QUOTE: One thing I've learned to appreciate as I've gotten a little older is direct forms of communication.
AUTHOR: Billy Corgan

QUOTE: My stay-married secret would probably be exercising good communication, not when you have to but all the time. I think if you do that, you kinda just cleanse the situations, so there's not build up. I think that's probably the best way to do it.
AUTHOR: Guy Fieri

QUOTE: A degree of lying - you know, white lies - seems to be inherent in all languages and all forms of communication.
AUTHOR: Matthew Lesko

QUOTE: Music is about communication... it isn't just something that maybe physically sounds good or orally sounds interesting; it's something far, far deeper than that.
AUTHOR: Evelyn Glennie

QUOTE: The five essential entrepreneurial skills for success are concentration, discrimination, organization, innovation and communication.
AUTHOR: Michael Faraday

QUOTE: Making movies is not rocket science. It's about relationships and communication and strangers coming together to see if they can get along harmoniously, productively, and creatively. That's a challenge. When it works, it's fantastic and will lift you up. When it doesn't work, it's almost just as fascinating.
AUTHOR: Julia Roberts

QUOTE: I spent a lot of years on the road, and what happens is you find out who your real friends are and you find out where your strengths and weaknesses lie in communication. I've had the same friends for 20 years now and I can count them on one hand.

QUOTE: The major advances in speed of communication and ability to interact took place more than a century ago. The shift from sailing ships to telegraph was far more radical than that from telephone to email!
AUTHOR: Noam Chomsky

QUOTE: Communication is so key.
AUTHOR: Ashley Tisdale

QUOTE: I like television. I still believe that television is the most powerful form of communication on Earth - I just hate what is being done with it.
AUTHOR: Alton Brown

QUOTE: People make music to get a reaction. Music is communication.
AUTHOR: Yoko Ono

QUOTE: To succeed, you will soon learn, as I did, the importance of a solid foundation in the basics of education - literacy, both verbal and numerical, and communication skills.
AUTHOR: Alan Greenspan

QUOTE: What is music anyway? It's a form of communication, and that's why I play the kind of music that I think - that I hope - can communicate with people.

QUOTE: The cure for sorrow is to learn something.
AUTHOR: Barbara Sher

QUOTE: Sympathy is two hearts tugging at one load.
AUTHOR: Charles Henry Parkhurst

QUOTE: Grief is only the memory of widowed affections.
AUTHOR: James Martineau

QUOTE: Pity may represent little more than the impersonal concern which prompts the mailing of a check, but true sympathy is the personal concern which demands the giving of one's soul.
AUTHOR: Martin Luther King, Jr.

QUOTE: It appears to be a law that you cannot have a deep sympathy with both man and nature.
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: The rule of friendship means there should be mutual sympathy between them, each supplying what the other lacks and trying to benefit the other, always using friendly and sincere words.
AUTHOR: Marcus Tullius Cicero

QUOTE: The community stagnates without the impulse of the individual. The impulse dies away without the sympathy of the community.

QUOTE: Two nations between whom there is no intercourse and no sympathy; who are as ignorant of each other's habits, thoughts, and feelings, as if they were dwellers in different zones, or inhabitants of different planets. The rich and the poor.

QUOTE: And whoever walks a furlong without sympathy walks to his own funeral drest in his shroud.
AUTHOR: Walt Whitman

QUOTE: Marriage must be a relation either of sympathy or of conquest.

QUOTE: Sympathy constitutes friendship; but in love there is a sort of antipathy, or opposing passion. Each strives to be the other, and both together make up one whole.

QUOTE: Staying married may have long-term benefits. You can elicit much more sympathy from friends over a bad marriage than you ever can from a good divorce.
AUTHOR: P. J. O'Rourke

QUOTE: I'm not looking for sympathy at all.
AUTHOR: Arnold Schwarzenegger

QUOTE: Both tears and sweat are salty, but they render a different result. Tears will get you sympathy; sweat will get you change.

QUOTE: Autumn wins you best by this its mute appeal to sympathy for its decay.

QUOTE: You are 27 or 28 right? It is very tough to live at that age. When nothing is sure. I have sympathy with you.
AUTHOR: Haruki Murakami

QUOTE: All sympathy not consistent with acknowledged virtue is but disguised selfishness.
AUTHOR: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

QUOTE: We do not learn by inference and deduction and the application of mathematics to philosophy, but by direct intercourse and sympathy.
AUTHOR: Richard M. Nixon

QUOTE: If men and women are to understand each other, to enter into each other's nature with mutual sympathy, and to become capable of genuine comradeship, the foundation must be laid in youth.

QUOTE: We must not permit our respect for the dead or our sympathy for the living to lead us into an act of injustice to the balance of the living.

QUOTE: Interest does not tie nations together; it sometimes separates them. But sympathy and understanding does unite them.

QUOTE: Children require guidance and sympathy far more than instruction.

QUOTE: Man is an artifact designed for space travel. He is not designed to remain in his present biologic state any more than a tadpole is designed to remain a tadpole.

QUOTE: Travel and society polish one, but a rolling stone gathers no moss, and a little moss is a good thing on a man.

QUOTE: I just travel the world with my backpack and my cameras and a bunch of Clif bars.
AUTHOR: Henry Rollins

QUOTE: All travel has its advantages. If the passenger visits better countries, he may learn to improve his own. And if fortune carries him to worse, he may learn to enjoy it.

QUOTE: Strange - is it not? That of the myriads who Before us passed the door of Darkness through, Not one returns to tell us of the road Which to discover we must travel too.

QUOTE: People who don't travel cannot have a global view, all they see is what's in front of them. Those people cannot accept new things because all they know is where they live.

QUOTE: To read a writer is for me not merely to get an idea of what he says, but to go off with him and travel in his company.

QUOTE: To bring up a child in the way he should go, travel that way yourself once in a while.

QUOTE: I travel light. I think the most important thing is to be in a good mood and enjoy life, wherever you are.

QUOTE: The good news is that real-world hands-on conservation is alive and well and catching on across the America I travel.

QUOTE: Travel in all the four quarters of the earth, yet you will find nothing anywhere. Whatever there is, is only here.

QUOTE: We travel together, passengers on a little spaceship, dependent on it's vulnerable reserves of air and soil, all committed, for our safety, to it's security and peace. Preserved from annihilation only by the care, the work and the love we give our fragile craft.

QUOTE: The photograph reverses the purpose of travel, which until now had been to encounter the strange and unfamiliar.
AUTHOR: Marshall McLuhan

QUOTE: Own only what you can always carry with you: know languages, know countries, know people. Let your memory be your travel bag.

QUOTE: Life is an unfoldment, and the further we travel the more truth we can comprehend. To understand the things that are at our door is the best preparation for understanding those that lie beyond.

QUOTE: The way to Heaven is ascending; we must be content to travel uphill, though it be hard and tiresome, and contrary to the natural bias of our flesh.

QUOTE: An English man does not travel to see English men.

QUOTE: The one thing I regret was that my work required an enormous amount of my time, and a lot of travel.

QUOTE: I want to see friends more and travel more.

QUOTE: I've met the most interesting people while flying or on a boat. These methods of travel seem to attract the kind of people I want to be with.

QUOTE: With any work worth its salt, you have to trust the author enough to take its measure. And if you apply too many preconceptions, you are not taking its measure.

QUOTE: Energy and environmental regulation, transportation, and broadband policy all benefit when legislators have a basic grounding in the technical concepts behind business models, products, and innovation.

AUTHOR: John Sununu

QUOTE: Even though I'm a hype man myself, I like the practicality of it all. People who understand how to turn a profit. At the end of the day, this is still business so I'm looking for real practical knowledge of how to actually make money, not necessarily raise it.
